primary facilitator of all core training modules; oversees moral recovery and leadership development. ‚Ä¢ DepEd ‚Äì Monitoring partner; leads dashboard/KPI training; quality assurance and integration with education systems. ‚Ä¢ LGU (Municipal/Barangay) ‚Äì Policy endorsement, logistical support, venue provision, mobilization. ‚Ä¢ FBOs ‚Äì Participants during municipal rollout; observers-in-training to transition as co-facilitators in barangay rollout. ‚Ä¢ CSOs ‚Äì Participants and trainees in community engagement; future co-facilitators at barangay level. ‚Ä¢ Other Agencies (DOH, DSWD, TESDA, etc.) ‚Äì Provide optional sectoral inputs for integration.

Part XII

Part XII ‚Äì Reference & Annex Compilation ________________________________________ Purpose: Part XII consolidates all supporting references, annexes, agreements, and tools of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP). While Part I establishes the conceptual and operational foundations, Part XII ensures accessibility, clarity, and sustainability by serving as the master repository of all reference materials. It secures the program‚Äôs institutional memory and guarantees that every phase, activity, and partnership remains grounded in a coherent framework, aligned with national priorities, and adaptable for scaling‚Äîfrom individual to global replication. ________________________________________ Content Overview 12.1 Annexes Summary Table ‚Ä¢ Consolidated listing of all annexes (A‚ÄìBR), organized by part and theme. ‚Ä¢ Quick-reference guide with annex title, placement, and purpose. üìå Annex BS ‚Äì Master Annexes Summary Table (detailed description and application of each annex, organized by relevance at the individual, family, community, and governance levels). ________________________________________ 12.2. MOA Compilation & Templates Repository This repository serves as the centralized archive and reference system for all Memoranda of Agreement (MOAs) within the ABMPD Ecosystem. It ensures that every partnership is properly documented, traceable, and aligned with the governance, branding, and compliance protocols of the program. Coverage & Categorization MOAs are organized according to ecosystem levels: ‚Ä¢ Core & Institutional MOAs ‚Äì KDMC Holding, ABMPD Holding, KCI, UFBO, UCSO, ABMPD Foundation, and Functional Subsidiaries. ‚Ä¢ Government Partnerships ‚Äì LGUs, NGA agencies, DepEd, DILG, and other government counterparts. ‚Ä¢ Civil Society & Faith-Based Partners ‚Äì CSOs, FBOs, interfaith councils, UFBO/UCSO linkages. ‚Ä¢ Technical & Donor Partners ‚Äì academia, international universities, INGOs, UN agencies, bilateral/multilateral donors, and private sector funders. Integration with Annex BT üìå Annex BT ‚Äì MOA Compilation & Templates Repository contains the full structure, including: ‚Ä¢ The MOA Repository Matrix (Annex BT-1 and subsequent templates). ‚Ä¢ Expanded MOA templates across partnership categories. ‚Ä¢ Branding & Documentation Manuals (logos, slogans, report and presentation templates, certificates, uniforms, and ID standards). ‚Ä¢ Usage & Integration Guide detailing rollout procedures, status updates, cross-referencing with BS/BX/BY, and compliance with Document Control Protocols. This ensures that the MOA system is not only a static archive but an active operational tool supporting rollout, donor negotiations, monitoring, and program credibility. ________________________________________ 12.3. Glossary of Terms ‚Ä¢ Definitions of key program concepts, acronyms, and operational terms. ‚Ä¢ Covers specialized terminology in moral recovery, governance, MEL, and institutional design. üìå Annex BU ‚Äì Glossary of Terms (includes policies on copyright, licensing, and enforcement for ABMPD materials). ________________________________________ 12.4. Abbreviations & Acronyms List ‚Ä¢ Alphabetized directory of acronyms used across the ABMPD Master Document. ‚Ä¢ Ensures consistency and clarity for readers and partners. üìå Annex BV ‚Äì Abbreviations & Acronyms Directory (includes a visual organizational diagram of Holding, Subsidiaries, Cooperatives, VFAs, PGOs, and Partners). ________________________________________ 12.5. Citation & References Framework ‚Ä¢ Standardized referencing style for internal and external documents. ‚Ä¢ Includes citations of government policies, academic references, and INGOs frameworks integrated into ABMPD. üìå Annex BW ‚Äì References & Citation Guide (protocol for citation format and integration of external frameworks). ________________________________________ 12.6. Document Control & Versioning ‚Ä¢ Protocol for maintaining master copies of annexes, MOAs, and program documents. ‚Ä¢ Includes version logs, approval signatures, and archival procedures. üìå Annex BX ‚Äì Document Control Protocols (version logs, approval workflow, archiving procedures). ________________________________________ 12.7. Closing Repository Index ‚Ä¢ Acts as the ‚Äúlast navigational map‚Äù‚Äîdirecting readers to every annex, MOA, glossary, and reference. ‚Ä¢ Ensures that the ABMPD Master Document is both a blueprint and a living knowledge base. üìå Annex BY ‚Äì Closing Repository Index (comprehensive directory of all annexes, linked to the roadmap and implementation phases). ‚ÄÉ 12.1. Annexes Summary Table(Undone Annex) ________________________________________ Purpose: This section presents the comprehensive Annexes Summary Table, which consolidates all annexes (Parts I‚ÄìXII). It provides a quick-reference index that shows how each annex is organized, what it contains, and its role in the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP). The goal is to ensure easy navigation, coherence, and traceability across the entire Master Document. ________________________________________ 12.1.1 Annex BS ‚Äì ABMPD Master Annex Index (Full Consolidated Table) ABMPD Master Annex Index Part Annex Code(s) Title Description / Purpose Part I ‚Äì Program Foundations A‚ÄìG Core Framework Annexes Introduces ABMPD‚Äôs vision, mission, objectives, theory of change, strategic roadmap, scaling principle, and executive matrices. Part II ‚Äì Implementation Model H‚ÄìN Implementation Design Annexes Provides the phased rollout model, transformation framework, curriculum integration, training flow, volunteer mobilization, and municipal‚Äìbarangay sequencing. Part III ‚Äì Ecosystem Structure O‚ÄìR Organizational & Ecosystem Annexes Defines the ABMPD ecosystem: KDMC Holding, ABMPD Holding, subsidiaries, PGOs, VFAs, partner LGUs, CSOs/FBOs, and their interconnections. Part IV ‚Äì Governance & Accountability Framework S‚ÄìX Governance Structures & Transitional Sustainability Establishes rules of engagement, compliance protocols, accountability standards, conflict resolution mechanisms, reporting dashboards, and transitional sustainability strategy. Part V ‚Äì Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning (MEL) Framework Y‚ÄìAG MEL Annexes Covers MEL purpose & alignment (Y), guiding principles (Z), architecture diagram (AA), MEL tools (AB), KPI dashboard (AC), reporting cycles (AD), learning/adaptation frameworks (AE), accountability protocols (AF), and global readiness toolkit (AG). Part VI ‚Äì Sustainability & Resource Mobilization Framework AH‚ÄìAK Sustainability Mechanisms Annexes Defines institutional mechanisms & subsidiaries (AH), diversified revenue streams & mobilization flows (AI), transparency & accountability protocols (AJ), and long-term sustainability roadmap (AK). Part VII ‚Äì Costing, Budgeting & Financing Framework AL‚ÄìAP Financing Annexes Provides budget flow diagram (AL), financing sources matrix (AM), financial accountability flowchart (AN), phased costing scenarios (AO), and risk & contingency fund protocols (AP). Part VIII ‚Äì Capacity Development & Institutional Strengthening AQ‚ÄìAW Capacity Annexes Establishes purpose & outcomes map (AQ), tiered development matrix (AR), training curriculum (AS), institutional roles (AT), tools catalog (AU), strengthening strategies (AV), and outcomes dashboard (AW). Part IX ‚Äì Global Replication & Diaspora Engagement AX‚ÄìBF Global Annexes Details global replication purpose & alignment map (AX), principles framework (AY), phases roadmap (AZ), diaspora engagement matrix (BA), global institutional architecture (BB), tools (BC), KPIs (BD), learning framework (BE), and long-term vision map (BF). Part X ‚Äì Sustainability & Legacy Framework BG‚ÄìBM Legacy Annexes Presents sustainability pillars map (BG), financial sustainability model (BH), succession & leadership continuity (BI), institutional integration strategies (BJ), community ownership framework (BK), global legacy impact map (BL), and 2050 legacy milestones (BM). Part XI ‚Äì Closing & Legacy Monitoring BN‚ÄìBR Closing Annexes Provides closing statement & commitment charter (BN), final vision & narrative (BO), legacy monitoring indicators & scorecards (BP), recognition framework (BQ), and final call to action & covenant (BR). Part XII ‚Äì Reference & Consolidation BS‚ÄìBZ (flexible) Consolidated Annexes Contains the summary of all annexes (matrix form), MOA compilations (Core, Inner, Middle, Outer Rings), glossary of terms, acronyms, references, and supporting documents. Serves as the comprehensive ‚Äúreference toolbox‚Äù for implementors, partners, and evaluators. ________________________________________ üìå Purpose of Part XII: ‚Ä¢ Serves as a one-stop reference for readers, implementors, and evaluators. ‚Ä¢ Provides a summary table of all annexes with quick navigation to each. ‚Ä¢ Consolidates the MOA compilations across ecosystem levels for contractual clarity. ‚Ä¢ Includes the Glossary, Acronyms, and supporting reference notes. ‚Ä¢ Ensures overall coherence and traceability of all documents in one section. ________________________________________ üìå Annex BS ‚Äì Master Annexes Summary Table (detailed description and application of each annex, organized by relevance at the individual, family, community, and governance levels). ‚ÄÉ 12.2. MOA Compilation & Templates Repository________________________________________ Purpose: This section serves as the centralized repository for all Memoranda of Agreement (MOAs) under the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP) ecosystem. It ensures that every institutional partnership, whether internal, government, civil society, or donor-based, is documented, standardized, and aligned with ABMPD‚Äôs governance framework. The repository also integrates branding and documentation templates (logos, slogans, standardized forms, and uniform guidelines) to ensure professional identity and operational coherence across the ecosystem. ________________________________________ 1. Organization of the Repository The MOA Repository is organized into four ecosystem levels, reflecting the concentric structure of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP). This design ensures clarity, traceability, and governance alignment, with each level capturing a distinct layer of institutional engagement. ________________________________________ 1. Core & Institutional MOAs The Core forms the strategic and governance backbone of the ecosystem. It anchors institutional legitimacy, oversight, and compliance. Without these MOAs, the broader ecosystem cannot operate. Key Entities: ‚Ä¢ KDMC Holding Company ‚Äì Strategic anchor, governance backbone, donor negotiation, and global partnerships. ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding Company ‚Äì Custodian of the program, oversight authority, subsidiary governance, and compliance. ‚Ä¢ Kingdom Chronicles Inc. (KCI) ‚Äì Lead implementor for training, curriculum development, MEL integration. ‚Ä¢ United Faith-Based Organizations (UFBO) ‚Äì Umbrella body for faith-based partners. ‚Ä¢ United Civil Society Organizations (UCSO) ‚Äì Umbrella body for civic and CSO networks. ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Future custodian of funds, sustainability mechanisms, and program endowments. ‚Ä¢ Functional Subsidiaries ‚Äì Finance, HR, Training, Research & MEL (operational arms under ABMPD Holding). Core Purpose: ‚Ä¢ Establish governance and oversight legitimacy. ‚Ä¢ Define accreditation, compliance, and custodianship roles. ‚Ä¢ Anchor the program with faith-based, civic, and academic legitimacy. ________________________________________ 2. Government Partnerships The Government Layer embeds ABMPD into the formal policy and governance system. These MOAs ensure legal validity, logistical support, and nationwide rollout. Key Entities: ‚Ä¢ Local Government Units (LGUs) ‚Äì Municipal, Provincial, and Regional governments providing venues, manpower, and logistical support. ‚Ä¢ National Government Agencies (NGAs) ‚Äì DepEd, DILG, CHED, TESDA, DOH, DSWD, and others as sectoral counterparts. ‚Ä¢ Inter-agency Councils & Regional Development Bodies ‚Äì Institutional platforms for integration into local and national development agendas. Core Purpose: ‚Ä¢ Provide legitimacy, venues, and logistical support for program rollout. ‚Ä¢ Ensure sectoral integration (education, health, youth, governance). ‚Ä¢ Establish framework agreements at provincial and regional levels. ________________________________________ 3. Civil Society & Faith-Based Partners The Civil Society and Faith-Based Layer expands ABMPD‚Äôs grassroots reach, moral authority, and community legitimacy. These partners ensure that the program is not only institutional but also community-owned and volunteer-driven. Key Entities: ‚Ä¢ Civil Society Organizations (CSOs), NGOs, POs, Cooperatives ‚Äì Mobilize volunteers, community networks, and civic service. ‚Ä¢ Faith-Based Organizations (FBOs) ‚Äì Churches, interfaith councils, mission groups, denominations. ‚Ä¢ UFBO / UCSO Engagement Agreements ‚Äì Frameworks for accrediting, organizing, and scaling partner groups at national and regional levels. Core Purpose: ‚Ä¢ Provide manpower, volunteers, and community leadership. ‚Ä¢ Amplify ABMPD‚Äôs values-based approach through moral and civic institutions. ‚Ä¢ Foster grassroots participation and social mobilization. ________________________________________ 4. Technical & Donor Partners The Technical and Donor Layer secures the resources, expertise, and global legitimacy of ABMPD. It ensures sustainability and provides pathways for replication beyond the Philippines. Key Entities: ‚Ä¢ Academic Institutions & Think Tanks ‚Äì Universities, research centers, and leadership institutes (local and foreign). ‚Ä¢ International NGOs (INGOs) ‚Äì INGOs providing technical cooperation, capacity-building, and global scaling support. ‚Ä¢ Multilateral & Bilateral Donors ‚Äì UN, ADB, WB, USAID, JICA, KOICA, etc. ‚Ä¢ Private Sector & CSR Programs ‚Äì Companies, family foundations, and philanthropists providing funding and logistics. ‚Ä¢ Diaspora-Based Donor Groups ‚Äì Overseas Filipinos and international solidarity partners. Core Purpose: ‚Ä¢ Mobilize funding, technical expertise, and sustainability resources. ‚Ä¢ Enable cross-border cooperation and international recognition. ‚Ä¢ Support scaling and replication through global platforms. ________________________________________ 2. Repository Contents Each MOA entry within the repository is designed for standardization, traceability, and compliance. The contents of each entry ensure that all agreements are captured in a consistent format, making the repository a reliable tool for governance, reporting, and donor engagement. ________________________________________ a. Annex Code ‚Ä¢ Definition: Unique identifier for each MOA within the Master Annex Matrix (e.g., BT-T1.3, BT-T5.2). ‚Ä¢ Purpose: Ensures ease of reference, cross-linking with Part XII subsections, and consistency in reporting. ‚Ä¢ Use Case: When citing agreements in progress reports, presentations, or donor submissions, the Annex Code provides a quick lookup. ________________________________________ b. Parties Involved ‚Ä¢ Definition: The principal and counterpart institutions, subsidiaries, or partner groups entering into the agreement. ‚Ä¢ Purpose: Documents the institutional relationships (e.g., KDMC ‚Üî UNDP, ABMPD Holding ‚Üî DepEd). ‚Ä¢ Details Captured: o Full legal names of parties o Designated subsidiaries or umbrella groups (UFBO, UCSO) o Any secondary endorsing institutions ________________________________________ c. Scope & Purpose ‚Ä¢ Definition: A narrative summary of the commitments, responsibilities, and coverage area. ‚Ä¢ Purpose: Clarifies what each MOA seeks to achieve (e.g., pilot testing in 10 municipalities, technical assistance for curriculum, donor funding for training). ‚Ä¢ Details Captured: o Geographic or sectoral coverage (municipal, provincial, national, international) o Specific commitments (training delivery, funding, curriculum integration, research) o Pilot phases or scaling intentions ________________________________________ d. Status ‚Ä¢ Definition: Current lifecycle stage of the MOA. ‚Ä¢ Categories: o üü® Draft ‚Äì Agreement text under preparation. o üü¶ Planned ‚Äì Parties agreed in principle, pending formalization. o üü© Active ‚Äì Signed and being implemented. o üüß Renewed ‚Äì Extended after original term. o üü• Terminated/Closed ‚Äì Ended, either completed or discontinued. ‚Ä¢ Purpose: Provides a real-time dashboard for leadership, donors, and custodians to track implementation progress. ________________________________________ e. Duration ‚Ä¢ Definition: Validity period and renewal terms of the MOA. ‚Ä¢ Details Captured: o Start and end dates o Fixed or rolling terms (e.g., 3 years, renewable every year) o Termination clauses and conditions ‚Ä¢ Purpose: Ensures alignment with project cycles, donor funding windows, and legal compliance. ________________________________________ f. Signatories ‚Ä¢ Definition: Authorized officials empowered to sign on behalf of each party. ‚Ä¢ Details Captured: o Full name, designation, and office/agency o Authority basis (e.g., Board resolution, Executive Order, Partnership Mandate) ‚Ä¢ Purpose: Guarantees legal enforceability and accountability. ________________________________________ g. Attachments ‚Ä¢ Definition: Supporting documents that provide operational, financial, or branding context. ‚Ä¢ Types of Attachments: o Standard templates (MOA forms, letterheads, reporting formats) o Branding integration (logos, slogans, campaign materials) o Financial custodianship notes (fund flow arrangements, fiduciary responsibilities) o Technical annexes (curriculum modules, training outlines, activity plans) ‚Ä¢ Purpose: Ensures each MOA is complete with references, reducing ambiguity during implementation. ________________________________________ 3. MOA Repository Matrix (Extract) The Repository Matrix functions as the master index of all MOAs, organized by ecosystem level (Core, Inner Ring, Middle Ring, Outer Ring). Each entry captures the institution, counterpart, scope, and current status. ________________________________________ Legend for Status ‚Ä¢ üü¶ Planned ‚Äì Identified and agreed in principle, drafting underway. ‚Ä¢ üü® Draft ‚Äì Draft MOA text in circulation or under review. ‚Ä¢ üü© Active ‚Äì Signed and currently implemented. ‚Ä¢ üüß Renewed ‚Äì Extended/updated after the first term. ‚Ä¢ üü• Terminated/Closed ‚Äì Concluded, either completed or discontinued. ________________________________________ Sample Extract from Repository Annex Institution / Entity MOA Counterpart Scope / Purpose Status BT-1 KDMC Holding ABMPD Holding Master MOA: Strategic anchor, governance backbone üü® Draft BT-1 ABMPD Holding Subsidiaries (Finance, HR, Training, RME) Oversight & compliance framework üü¶ Planned BT-1 ABMPD Holding DepEd (Provincial / Division / Regional Offices) Pilot integration of MRP into schools üü© Active BT-2 Kingdom Chronicles Inc. (KCI) State Universities & HEIs Curriculum research, Monitoring‚ÄìEvaluation‚ÄìLearning (MEL) integration üü© Active BT-2 United Faith-Based Organizations (UFBO) Interfaith Networks Spiritual‚Äìmoral leadership collaboration üüß Renewed BT-3 United Civil Society Organizations (UCSO) CSO / NGO Coalition Volunteer mobilization & capacity-building üü¶ Planned BT-4 ABMPD Foundation Philanthropic & CSR Partners Resource mobilization, fiduciary custodianship üü¶ Planned BT-4 KDMC Holding / ABMPD Holding UNDP / INGOs / Multilaterals Technical cooperation, donor funding, capacity support üü® Draft ________________________________________ Notes on Usage 1. Ecosystem Alignment: Each Annex BT level corresponds to the four ecosystem rings (Core, Inner Ring, Middle Ring, Outer Ring). 2. Cross-Referencing: Each entry links to its expanded narrative in Section 4: Expanded MOA Summaries per Annex. 3. Dynamic Updates: The Repository Matrix is a living document, updated as MOAs shift from Planned ‚Üí Draft ‚Üí Active ‚Üí Renewed. 4. Attachments: Where applicable, entries are hyperlinked to their template text, branding integration, or custodianship notes stored under Annex BT-T. üìå Full repository table is consolidated in Annex BT. ________________________________________ 4. Branding & Documentation Templates (Integrated with MOAs) As part of Annex BT, the Branding Manual & Templates Repository ensures a unified and professional identity across the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP) ecosystem. This guarantees that every Memorandum of Agreement (MOA), communication, and field-level activity carries the same standards of legitimacy, credibility, and visibility. 1. Logos & Emblems ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Master Logo ‚Äì Official seal for the entire MRP ecosystem. ‚Ä¢ KDMC Holding Logo ‚Äì Strategic governance anchor branding. ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding Logo ‚Äì Oversight and compliance authority. ‚Ä¢ Subsidiary Logos ‚Äì Distinct but harmonized emblems for Finance, HR, Training, and RME. ‚Ä¢ Partner Logos ‚Äì Guidelines for co-branding with government, academe, CSOs, INGOs, and donors. ‚Ä¢ Usage Rules ‚Äì Placement hierarchy (ABMPD first, partner second), minimum sizes, background control, and color palette references. 2. Official Slogans & Taglines ‚Ä¢ Core Slogan (MRP-wide) ‚Äì Short, values-driven statement (for campaign and advocacy). ‚Ä¢ Thematic Taglines ‚Äì Customized per program tier (education, governance, civic, faith-based). ‚Ä¢ Campaign Hashtags ‚Äì For social media integration (#MRPNationwide, #MoralRecoveryPH). ‚Ä¢ Usage Rules ‚Äì Tone of voice guide (positive, values-based, inclusive), multilingual options (English, Filipino, regional dialects). 3. Templates (Standardized Forms & Documents) ‚Ä¢ MOA Templates ‚Äì Modular, standardized across BT-T1 to BT-T7 categories. ‚Ä¢ Administrative Templates ‚Äì Standard letterheads, official memos, email signatures. ‚Ä¢ Reports & MEL Templates ‚Äì Standardized progress reports, monitoring forms, and evaluation formats. ‚Ä¢ Presentation Decks ‚Äì PowerPoint/Keynote designs with ABMPD branding. ‚Ä¢ Certificates ‚Äì Standard designs for training, accreditation, and recognition events. ‚Ä¢ Usage Rules ‚Äì Mandatory use for all official communications; annexed in soft and editable formats. 4. Uniform & ID Standards ‚Ä¢ Staff Uniforms ‚Äì Standard colors, cuts, and insignia for subsidiaries and field coordinators. ‚Ä¢ VFA/MVFA Uniforms ‚Äì Distinct vest/shirt for volunteers and municipal coordinators. ‚Ä¢ Ambassador Uniforms ‚Äì Formal attire guidelines for program ambassadors and spokespersons. ‚Ä¢ Identification Cards (IDs) ‚Äì Standard format (logo placement, QR code, expiry, security features). ‚Ä¢ Usage Rules ‚Äì Required during official activities, rollout events, and inter-agency engagements. 5. Integration with MOAs ‚Ä¢ Co-Branding Clause ‚Äì All MOAs include branding provisions (logo usage, event materials, joint publications). ‚Ä¢ Custodianship of Logos & Templates ‚Äì KDMC & ABMPD Holding approve all branding materials. ‚Ä¢ Dual-Role Partners ‚Äì Special branding notes for partners like The 700 Club Asia, FEBC (co-branding for both Inner & Outer Rings). ‚Ä¢ Archiving Protocol ‚Äì All branding assets stored under Annex BT and linked with Annex BX (Document Control Protocols). ________________________________________ Governance Notes ‚Ä¢ All MOAs are subject to Document Control Protocols (Annex BX) for versioning and archival. ‚Ä¢ Custodianship of Funds & Assets (temporary hosting until ABMPD Foundation assumes role) is clearly defined in each MOA. ‚Ä¢ Dual-role organizations (e.g., The 700 Club Asia, FEBC) are cross-referenced if they appear in multiple MOA categories. ________________________________________ Integration with Part XII This MOA Repository works in tandem with: ‚Ä¢ Annex BS (Master Annexes Summary Table) ‚Äì placement of each MOA annex. ‚Ä¢ Annex BU (Glossary of Terms) ‚Äì standardized definitions of MOA-related terms. ‚Ä¢ Annex BX (Document Control Protocols) ‚Äì ensuring MOA versions are updated. ‚Ä¢ Annex BY (Closing Repository Index) ‚Äì final cross-referencing of all MOAs. ________________________________________ üìå Annex BT ‚Äì MOA Compilation & Templates Repository (includes branding manuals: logos, slogans, templates, and uniform standards) ‚ÄÉ Annex BS ‚Äì Master Annexes Summary Table (Undone)________________________________________ Introduction: The Master Annexes Summary Table serves as the consolidated and expanded directory of all annexes under the Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) ‚Äì Moral Recovery Program (MRP). It functions as the program‚Äôs navigational compass, bringing together all annexes from Parts I‚ÄìXII into a single organized reference. This annex is designed to: ‚Ä¢ Provide quick orientation on the scope and content of each annex. ‚Ä¢ Show logical organization by part, annex code, and theme. ‚Ä¢ Clarify the role and application of each annex across four levels of impact: o Individual ‚Äì transformation of personal values, integrity, and moral character. o Family ‚Äì strengthening the household as the first school of values. o Community ‚Äì building collective responsibility, volunteerism, and social cohesion. o Governance ‚Äì institutionalizing ethical standards in leadership, systems, and public service. ‚Ä¢ Ensure coherence and traceability across the ABMPD Master Document, serving as the anchor for cross-referencing all annexes, agreements, and supporting materials. Scope & Structure: ‚Ä¢ Includes all annexes A‚ÄìBZ (Parts I‚ÄìXII). ‚Ä¢ Organized in a matrix format, showing: Part, Annex Code, Title, Description/Purpose, and Level of Application (I/F/C/G). ‚Ä¢ Designed for both narrative readers and technical implementors‚Äîwhether policy-makers, trainers, community volunteers, or partner institutions. Integration: ‚Ä¢ Directly linked with Annex BX (Document Control Protocols) for versioning and updates. ‚Ä¢ Complements Annex BY (Closing Repository Index) for final navigation. ‚Ä¢ Supports evaluators and auditors in validating the completeness, consistency, and alignment of all ABMPD documentation. üìå This annex functions not only as a summary index, but also as a living reference tool‚Äîcontinuously updated as the ABMPD ecosystem grows, partnerships expand, and new annexes are added. ________________________________________ 1. List of Core Values & Definitions ‚ÄÉ Annex BT ‚Äì MOA Compilation & Templates Repository________________________________________ 1. Introduction: This annex serves as the official repository and index of all Memoranda of Agreement (MOAs) within the ABMPD Ecosystem. It consolidates, organizes, and standardizes every institutional partnership‚Äîwhether internal, governmental, civil society, donor-based, or international‚Äîto ensure that all agreements are traceable, aligned with ABMPD‚Äôs governance framework, and compliant with established protocols. The compilation is more than a static record: it is a working repository that provides both program implementors and external partners with a clear roadmap of contractual commitments, enabling accountability, transparency, and alignment across the entire ABMPD ecosystem. Scope: The repository covers all ecosystem levels of the ABMPD Masterplan: 1. Core & Institutional MOAs ‚Äì Strategic governance anchors (KDMC Holding, ABMPD Holding, subsidiaries, KCI, UFBO, UCSO, Foundation). 2. Inner Ring MOAs ‚Äì Functional and operational arms (implementors, subsidiaries, accreditation partners). 3. Middle Ring MOAs ‚Äì Government integration agreements (LGUs, PGOs, barangays, NGA agencies, inter-LGU clusters). 4. Outer Ring MOAs ‚Äì Broad external partnerships (faith-based organizations, CSOs, academic institutions, donors, INGOs, multilateral partners). Integration Note: This annex is cross-linked with other reference annexes to ensure full traceability and usability: ‚Ä¢ Annex BS ‚Äì Master Annexes Summary Table (placement of all annexes including MOAs). ‚Ä¢ Annex BU ‚Äì Glossary of Terms (standardized definitions of MOA-related concepts). ‚Ä¢ Annex BX ‚Äì Document Control Protocols (versioning, archival, and updates). ‚Ä¢ Annex BY ‚Äì Closing Repository Index (final consolidated navigation of annexes and agreements). Status Legend: Each MOA is tagged with a tracker code indicating its current state: ‚Ä¢ üü¶ Planned ‚Äì Identified but not yet drafted. ‚Ä¢ üü® Draft ‚Äì Currently being prepared or under review. ‚Ä¢ üüß Temporary ‚Äì Provisional arrangement pending final umbrella body or institution. ‚Ä¢ üü© Pilot ‚Äì Signed for trial or limited implementation. ‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Signed ‚Äì Fully executed and legally binding. ‚Ä¢ üîÑ Ongoing ‚Äì Continuous by nature, requiring regular updates (e.g., regulators, donor reporting). üìå This cover page frames Annex BT as both a legal-logistical backbone and a strategic reference tool for the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program. ________________________________________ 2. Repository Organization The MOA Compilation & Templates Repository is structured according to the ecosystem levels of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP). Each level reflects a distinct layer of partnership‚Äîfrom the strategic governance center to the broad external ecosystem‚Äîand is assigned a dedicated sub-annex for clarity, traceability, and ease of use. This tiered organization ensures that MOAs are not treated as isolated contracts, but as interconnected agreements that collectively sustain ABMPD‚Äôs moral recovery agenda across local, national, and global dimensions. ________________________________________ Sub-Annex Organization 1. üìå Annex BT-1 ‚Äì Core MOAs o Coverage: Strategic and governance backbone of the ABMPD ecosystem. o Includes: ÔÇß KDMC Holding Company (strategic anchor). ÔÇß ABMPD Holding Company (oversight of subsidiaries). ÔÇß Regulators and compliance bodies (SEC, BIR, COA, DILG, DepEd). ÔÇß Academic and faith-based media partners (ISU, AIM, The 700 Club Asia, FEBC). o Purpose: Establishes institutional legitimacy, defines custodianship arrangements, and sets the governance framework for all other agreements. ________________________________________ 2. üìå Annex BT-2 ‚Äì Inner Ring MOAs o Coverage: Operational and functional arms translating governance into implementation. o Includes: ÔÇß KCI (Core Implementor). ÔÇß UFBO (Unified Faith-Based Organizations). ÔÇß UCSO (Unified Civil Society Organizations). ÔÇß ABMPD Foundation & Functional Subsidiaries (Finance, HR, Training, RME). o Purpose: Ensures structured rollout, accreditation, training, and mobilization of both faith-based and civic organizations, while providing technical and financial backbone support. ________________________________________ 3. üìå Annex BT-3 ‚Äì Middle Ring MOAs o Coverage: Government institutionalization and integration at the provincial, city, and municipal levels. o Includes: ÔÇß Provincial Government Units (PGOs). ÔÇß City/Municipal LGUs. ÔÇß Barangay-level agreements. ÔÇß NGA sectoral partnerships (DepEd, DILG, DOH, DSWD, TESDA, CHED). ÔÇß Inter-LGU cluster MOAs. o Purpose: Provides legitimacy, logistical support, and resource-sharing through official government structures, ensuring ABMPD is embedded into local and regional governance systems. ________________________________________ 4. üìå Annex BT-4 ‚Äì Outer Ring MOAs o Coverage: Broad external partnerships that expand ABMPD‚Äôs reach, credibility, and sustainability. o Includes: ÔÇß Faith-Based Organizations (church councils, interfaith alliances). ÔÇß Civil Society Organizations (NGOs, POs, cooperatives, civic groups). ÔÇß Academic and Research Institutions (local SUCs, HEIs, foreign universities). ÔÇß Private sector partners (CSR, chambers of commerce, philanthropic foundations). ÔÇß International & Multilateral Agencies (UN, ADB, WB, INGOs, bilateral donors). o Purpose: Anchors external legitimacy, secures technical and financial cooperation, and enables global replication and diaspora engagement. ________________________________________ 5. üìå Annex BT-T ‚Äì Templates & Standard Clauses o Coverage: Master collection of MOA templates, sample clauses, and standard formats. o Includes: ÔÇß Core governance MOA templates (Holding‚ÄìSubsidiaries). ÔÇß Government partnership templates (LGUs, NGAs). ÔÇß Academic & technical templates (SUCs, HEIs). ÔÇß Faith-based and CSO accreditation MOAs. ÔÇß CSR, donor, and international agency MOA templates. o Purpose: Ensures all MOAs follow a standardized structure, embed legal safeguards, and remain consistent with ABMPD‚Äôs governance and MEL frameworks. ________________________________________ üìå Integration Note: Each sub-annex (BT-1 to BT-4, BT-T) is cross-referenced with: ‚Ä¢ Annex BS (Master Annexes Summary Table) ‚Äì placement of MOAs within the full annex matrix. ‚Ä¢ Annex BX (Document Control Protocols) ‚Äì version logs and updates. ‚Ä¢ Annex BY (Closing Repository Index) ‚Äì final consolidated navigation. ________________________________________ 3. MOA Repository Index (Matrix) The MOA Repository Index serves as the master reference map for all Memoranda of Agreement (MOAs) within the ABMPD Ecosystem. It consolidates every institutional partnership into a single matrix, ensuring that agreements are: ‚Ä¢ Easily navigable ‚Äì by annex code and ecosystem level. ‚Ä¢ Traceable ‚Äì with clear counterpart institutions and scope. ‚Ä¢ Actionable ‚Äì showing the current status, duration, and responsible signatories. This index functions as both a quick-reference guide and a working tracker for program managers, auditors, and evaluators. ________________________________________ Matrix Columns Each MOA entry in the repository includes the following details: ‚Ä¢ Annex ‚Äì Sub-annex placement (BT-1, BT-2, BT-3, BT-4, BT-T). ‚Ä¢ Institution / Entity ‚Äì Primary ABMPD party (Holding, Subsidiary, KCI, UFBO, UCSO, etc.). ‚Ä¢ MOA Counterpart ‚Äì Partner institution (government, academe, donors, CSOs, FBOs, INGOs, etc.). ‚Ä¢ Scope / Purpose ‚Äì Nature of the agreement, commitments, coverage, or pilot application. ‚Ä¢ Status ‚Äì Current progress (üü¶ Planned, üü® Draft, üüß Temporary, üü© Pilot, ‚úÖ Signed, üîÑ Ongoing). ‚Ä¢ (Optional) Duration / Term ‚Äì Contract validity or renewal terms. ‚Ä¢ (Optional) Signatories ‚Äì Key authorized officials. ________________________________________ Sample Extract of MOA Repository Matrix Annex Institution / Entity MOA Counterpart Scope / Purpose Status BT-1 KDMC Holding ABMPD Holding Master MOA: strategic anchor, governance backbone üü® Draft BT-1 ABMPD Holding Subsidiaries (Finance, HR, Training, RME) Oversight & compliance framework üü¶ Planned BT-1 ABMPD Holding DepEd (Provincial / Regional) Curriculum validation, LGU coordination, interim custodianship of donor funds üü® Draft BT-1 ABMPD Holding SUCs (e.g., ISU, Cagayan SUC) Research validation, training integration, Option B interim custodianship üü® Draft BT-2 KCI (Core Implementor) LGUs (City / Municipal) Rollout MOAs: venues, manpower, logistics üü¶ Planned BT-2 KCI Barangay LGUs Pilot rollout and municipal saturation agreements üü© Pilot BT-2 UFBO Local FBOs (church councils) Accreditation & values formation agreements üü¶ Planned BT-2 UCSO CSOs, NGOs, civic groups Accreditation & partnership for civic initiatives üü¶ Planned BT-3 PGOs ABMPD Holding / KCI Provincial framework MOA institutionalizing ABMPD‚ÄìMRP üü¶ Planned BT-3 City / Municipal LGUs Barangay LGUs Cascading rollout sub-MOAs to barangays üü© Pilot BT-3 LGUs NGA Agencies (DILG, DepEd) Policy alignment, program monitoring, resource integration üü® Draft BT-4 UFBO NCCP‚ÄìPCEC Alliance National faith-based alignment üü¶ Planned BT-4 UCSO NGO & Civic Federations Community service, volunteer mobilization üü¶ Planned BT-4 Subsidiaries (Finance) CSR Partners & Donors Funding & sustainability with custodianship clause üîÑ Ongoing BT-4 Foundation UN / ADB / World Bank Replication, technical cooperation, program scaling üü¶ Planned ________________________________________ üìå Usage Note: ‚Ä¢ This matrix is continuously updated as MOAs progress from Planned ‚Üí Draft ‚Üí Pilot ‚Üí Signed. ‚Ä¢ Detailed narratives for each entry are provided in their respective Expanded Sub-Annex (BT-1 to BT-4). ‚Ä¢ All MOAs are governed by Document Control Protocols (Annex BX) to ensure versioning, archival, and compliance. ________________________________________ 4. MOA Summaries per Annex The MOA Summaries present the narrative and detailed breakdown of all Memoranda of Agreement (MOAs) within the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP) ecosystem. Each sub-annex corresponds to one ecosystem level, moving from the strategic governance center to the broad outer partnerships. This section ensures that every MOA is not only catalogued in the repository but also explained in terms of its strategic role, institutional counterpart, and implementation purpose. ________________________________________ üìé Annex BT-1 ‚Äì Core MOAs Description: The Core represents the strategic and governance backbone of the ABMPD ecosystem. It anchors institutional legitimacy, legal authority, compliance, and oversight across all program layers. MOA Basis: ‚Ä¢ Establishes the central authority of KDMC Holding and ABMPD Holding. ‚Ä¢ Provides custodianship arrangements (temporary and final). ‚Ä¢ Defines governance, compliance, and accreditation frameworks. ‚Ä¢ Brings in academic legitimacy and faith-based media amplification. List of MOAs ‚Äì Core: 1. KDMC Holding ‚Üî ABMPD Holding ‚Äì Master MOA establishing ABMPD Holding as the central custodian of MRP. (üü® Draft) 2. ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Subsidiaries ‚Äì Oversight and compliance agreements. (üü¶ Planned) 3. ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Regulators (DepEd, DILG, SEC, BIR, COA) ‚Äì Validation, accreditation, interim custodianship. (üü® Draft / üîÑ Ongoing) 4. ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Academic Partners (ISU, AIM, SUCs) ‚Äì Research validation, module development. (üü® Draft) 5. ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Faith-Based Media (The 700 Club Asia, FEBC) ‚Äì Values-driven advocacy, storytelling, regional broadcasting. (üü¶ Planned / üü® Draft) 6. ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Donors/Foundations (CSR, Philanthropy) ‚Äì Seed funding, custodianship clauses. (üü¶ Planned) Special Notes: Temporary Fund Custodianship: ‚Ä¢ DepEd (Provincial/Regional Offices) ‚Üí Primary interim custodian for education-linked programs and donor funds. ‚Ä¢ SUCs (e.g., ISU, regional universities) ‚Üí Option B custodian for academic/research-related funds. ‚Ä¢ Municipal LGUs ‚Üí Option C custodian, particularly when funds are directly tied to local rollout, barangay-level implementation, or municipal-based donor contributions. ‚Ä¢ Condition: All these roles are time-bound and transitional only, effective until the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary is fully accredited (SEC, BIR, COA, BSP if needed). Summary: Core MOAs provide the anchor of legitimacy and compliance, without which the rest of the ecosystem cannot operate. ________________________________________ üìé Annex BT-2 ‚Äì Inner Ring MOAs Description: The Inner Ring translates governance into day-to-day operationalization. It covers the implementor (KCI), umbrella bodies (UFBO, UCSO), and ABMPD subsidiaries. MOA Basis: ‚Ä¢ KCI serves as the Core Implementor of ABMPD‚ÄìMRP. ‚Ä¢ UFBO & UCSO handle faith-based and civic accreditation. ‚Ä¢ Subsidiaries (Finance, HR, Training, RME) ensure technical, financial, and monitoring systems. List of MOAs ‚Äì Inner Ring: 1. KCI ‚Üî ABMPD Holding ‚Äì Framework MOA authorizing KCI as lead implementor. (üü® Draft) 2. KCI ‚Üî LGUs (Municipal, Barangay) ‚Äì Rollout agreements for logistics, manpower, venues. (üü¶ Planned / üü© Pilot) 3. KCI ‚Üî VFAs ‚Äì Volunteer recruitment & mobilization. (üü© Pilot) 4. UFBO ‚Üî FBOs / Councils ‚Äì Accreditation of faith-based partners. (üü¶ Planned) 5. UCSO ‚Üî CSOs / NGOs ‚Äì Accreditation of civic partners. (üü¶ Planned) 6. Foundation & Subsidiaries ‚Üî Partners ‚Äì Donors, TESDA, CHED, AIM, ISU (training, funding, compliance, research). (üü¶ Planned / üîÑ Ongoing) Special Notes: ‚Ä¢ Temporary MOAs are used until UFBO & UCSO are fully institutionalized. ‚Ä¢ Faith-based and media partners may appear here and in Outer Ring (dual role). Summary: The Inner Ring enables operational rollout, ensuring that ABMPD‚Äôs governance framework is translated into implementable systems. ________________________________________ üìé Annex BT-3 ‚Äì Middle Ring MOAs Description: The Middle Ring secures government legitimacy at provincial, city, and municipal levels, ensuring ABMPD‚ÄìMRP is embedded into LGU governance structures. MOA Basis: ‚Ä¢ Provincial Governments institutionalize ABMPD via framework agreements. ‚Ä¢ City and Municipal LGUs provide venues, manpower, and logistics. ‚Ä¢ Barangay LGUs support grassroots rollouts. ‚Ä¢ Inter-LGU and NGA sectoral partnerships ensure coherence and integration. List of MOAs ‚Äì Middle Ring: 1. PGOs ‚Üî ABMPD Holding / KCI ‚Äì Provincial framework MOAs. (üü¶ Planned / üü® Draft) 2. City/Municipal LGUs ‚Üî KCI ‚Äì Rollout agreements for barangay saturation. (üü¶ Planned / üü© Pilot) 3. Barangay LGUs ‚Üî KCI ‚Äì Barangay-level implementation. (üü¶ Planned) 4. PGOs / LGUs ‚Üî NGA Agencies (DepEd, DILG, DOH, TESDA, CHED) ‚Äì Sectoral alignment. (üü¶ Planned) 5. Inter-LGU Consortiums ‚Äì Cluster-based MOAs for shared resources. (üü¶ Planned) Special Notes: ‚Ä¢ KCI acts as the authorized signatory for LGU-level rollouts, by authority of ABMPD Holding. Summary: Middle Ring MOAs secure policy legitimacy and logistical support from government structures, embedding ABMPD into formal governance systems. ________________________________________ üìé Annex BT-4 ‚Äì Outer Ring MOAs Description: The Outer Ring represents ABMPD‚Äôs broadest partnership ecosystem, ensuring external legitimacy, global scaling, and resource mobilization. MOA Basis: ‚Ä¢ FBOs & CSOs ‚Üí Expand grassroots and moral authority. ‚Ä¢ Academia ‚Üí Provide validation and research. ‚Ä¢ Private Sector & CSR ‚Üí Provide funding and logistics. ‚Ä¢ INGOs & Multilaterals ‚Üí Enable replication and international cooperation. List of MOAs ‚Äì Outer Ring: 1. UFBO ‚Üî National FBO Alliances (NCCP‚ÄìPCEC) ‚Äì National faith-based legitimacy. (üü¶ Planned) 2. UCSO ‚Üî National CSO Networks ‚Äì Civic service and scaling. (üü¶ Planned) 3. Subsidiaries ‚Üî SUCs, HEIs, Foreign Universities ‚Äì Research & validation. (üü® Draft / üü¶ Planned) 4. Finance Subsidiary ‚Üî CSR / Donors ‚Äì Sustainability and funding. (üîÑ Ongoing) 5. Foundation ‚Üî Multilaterals (UN, ADB, WB, Bilateral Donors) ‚Äì Technical cooperation & scaling. (üü¶ Planned) 6. Subsidiaries ‚Üî The 700 Club Asia, FEBC ‚Äì Advocacy and storytelling. (üü¶ Planned) Special Notes: ‚Ä¢ Dual Role Clause: The 700 Club Asia and FEBC serve both as subsidiary-linked partners (Inner Ring) and external media amplifiers (Outer Ring). Summary: Outer Ring MOAs provide breadth, legitimacy, and resources, securing ABMPD‚Äôs sustainability and global replication capacity. ________________________________________ 5. Templates & Standard Clauses (Annex BT-T) Introduction Annex BT-T serves as the master toolkit of standardized Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) templates and clauses within the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP). It ensures that all institutional partnerships‚Äîwhether with core governance entities, government units, civil society, academia, or international partners‚Äîadhere to a consistent, legally sound, and governance-aligned structure. This annex is designed to: ‚Ä¢ Standardize MOA language across all levels of the ABMPD ecosystem. ‚Ä¢ Ensure compliance with national laws, ABMPD governance policies, and MEL protocols. ‚Ä¢ Provide flexibility through modular clauses adaptable to specific institutional contexts. ‚Ä¢ Embed custodianship safeguards (DepEd/SUCs/LGUs as interim ‚Üí ABMPD Foundation as final). ________________________________________ Template Categories (Sub-Templates) 1. Core Templates (BT-T1) o KDMC ‚Üî ABMPD Holding (strategic anchor MOA). o ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Subsidiaries (Finance, HR, Training, RME). o Purpose: Establish central governance, oversight, and compliance frameworks. 2. Government Templates (BT-T2) o LGUs (Provincial, Municipal, Barangay). o National Government Agencies (DepEd, DILG, CHED, TESDA, DOH, DSWD, etc.). o Purpose: Define policy alignment, rollout support, venues, logistical and manpower assistance. 3. Academic Templates (BT-T3) o SUCs and HEIs (ISU, AIM, regional universities). o Purpose: Research validation, training integration, leadership development, and interim custodianship of funds. 4. Faith-Based Templates (BT-T4) o FBOs (church networks, denominations, interfaith councils). o Faith-based media (The 700 Club Asia, FEBC). o Purpose: Accreditation, values integration, moral recovery alignment, and public advocacy. 5. Civil Society Templates (BT-T5) o CSOs, NGOs, People‚Äôs Organizations (POs), civic federations, cooperatives. o Purpose: Volunteer mobilization, community service integration, civic engagement. 6. Private Sector & Donor Templates (BT-T6) o CSR programs, family foundations, philanthropists. o Purpose: Financial sponsorship, sustainability endowment, corporate social responsibility initiatives. 7. International Templates (BT-T7) o INGOs, UN agencies, multilateral organizations (ADB, WB), bilateral donors (USAID, JICA, KOICA). o Purpose: Scaling, replication, technical cooperation, cross-border validation. ________________________________________ Standard Clauses (Embedded in All Templates) 1. Parties & Authority ‚Äì Legal identities of contracting parties; recognition of mandates. 2. Purpose & Objectives ‚Äì Alignment with ABMPD Masterplan; goals of partnership. 3. Roles & Responsibilities ‚Äì Deliverables and accountability. 4. Governance & Oversight ‚Äì Oversight mechanisms, MEL alignment. 5. Funding & Custodianship Clause ‚Äì Interim custodianship (DepEd/SUCs/LGUs) ‚Üí final custodianship (ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary). 6. Term & Termination ‚Äì Agreement duration, renewal, termination process. 7. Compliance & Legal Safeguards ‚Äì Alignment with laws, ABMPD policies, and arbitration rules. 8. Confidentiality & Data Protection ‚Äì Data Privacy Act compliance, secure handling of sensitive data. 9. Effectivity & Execution ‚Äì Date of effectivity, notarization, and signing requirements. ________________________________________ Integration Note ‚Ä¢ Annex BT-T is cross-referenced with: o Annex BS ‚Üí Placement of MOAs in the Master Annex Matrix. o Annex BX ‚Üí Document Control Protocols (versioning). o Annex BY ‚Üí Final Repository Index (closing). ‚Ä¢ Templates are modular: Program managers can select and adapt clauses per ecosystem level. ‚Ä¢ Legal counsel review is mandatory before final MOA signing. üìå Annex BT-T1 ‚Äì Core Templates Coverage ‚Ä¢ KDMC Holding ‚Üî ABMPD Holding (Master MOA: strategic anchor). ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Subsidiaries (Finance, HR, Training, RME). ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Regulators (SEC, BIR, COA, DILG, DepEd). ________________________________________ Summary Table of Core MOA Templates Sub-Annex Code Parties Involved Scope / Purpose Notes BT-T1.1 KDMC Holding ‚Üî ABMPD Holding Master MOA ‚Äì establishes ABMPD Holding under KDMC‚Äôs strategic anchor; sets governance backbone and institutional legitimacy. Serves as the ‚Äúmother MOA‚Äù guiding all other agreements. BT-T1.2 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Subsidiaries (Finance, HR, Training, RME) Oversight MOAs ‚Äì formalize operational mandates, accountability, and subsidiary governance. Defines reporting lines, MEL compliance, and interim custodianship. BT-T1.3 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Regulators (SEC, BIR, COA, DILG, DepEd) Compliance MOAs ‚Äì secure legal recognition, accreditation, and regulatory alignment. Includes interim custodianship clause (DepEd, SUCs, Municipal LGUs ‚Üí final Foundation Finance Subsidiary). ________________________________________ üìå Integration Note: ‚Ä¢ BT-T1.1 anchors legitimacy. ‚Ä¢ BT-T1.2 ensures internal cohesion (subsidiaries). ‚Ä¢ BT-T1.3 ensures external legal compliance. Together, these Core Templates provide the institutional backbone for all Inner, Middle, and Outer Ring MOAs (Annex BT-2 to BT-4). ________________________________________ üìå Placement Clarification: ‚Ä¢ Academic Partner MOAs (ISU, AIM, SUCs) ‚Üí deferred to Annex BT-T3 (Academic Templates). ‚Ä¢ Faith-Based Media MOAs (The 700 Club Asia, FEBC) ‚Üí deferred to Annex BT-T4 (FBO/CSO Templates). ‚Ä¢ Donor/Philanthropy MOAs ‚Üí deferred to Annex BT-T4 (Private/Donor Templates). ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T1.1 ‚Äì Master MOA: KDMC Holding ‚Üî ABMPD Holding (Master MOA ‚Äì Strategic Anchor) ________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Kingdom Development & Management Corporation (KDMC Holding), a duly registered entity serving as the strategic anchor and governance backbone of ABMPD, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúKDMC Holding‚Äù; -and- Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù. Both parties are collectively referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to establish the ABMPD Holding as the governance, oversight, and operational custodian of the ABMPD‚ÄìMRP under the strategic guidance of KDMC Holding. Objectives include: 1. Anchoring the institutional legitimacy and credibility of ABMPD. 2. Establishing oversight over subsidiaries (Finance, HR, Training, RME). 3. Coordinating with regulators (SEC, BIR, COA) to ensure compliance. 4. Providing the framework for ABMPD‚Äôs moral recovery initiatives nationwide. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES KDMC Holding shall: 1. Provide strategic direction and governance standards. 2. Ensure legal compliance and institutional credibility. 3. Authorize ABMPD Holding to manage program operations. ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Serve as the custodian and lead coordinator of ABMPD‚ÄìMRP. 2. Exercise oversight authority over subsidiaries. 3. Manage MOA signings with Inner, Middle, and Outer Ring partners. 4. Establish financial custodianship through interim partners (DepEd, SUCs, Municipal LGUs) until the ABMPD Foundation Finance Subsidiary is accredited. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. ABMPD Holding shall report regularly to KDMC Holding. 2. Oversight shall be aligned with the ABMPD Governance & MEL Framework. 3. Disputes shall be resolved through mediation and, if unresolved, submitted to arbitration under Philippine law. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Temporary Custodianship: Interim custodians may include DepEd (Provincial/Regional Offices), SUCs (e.g., ISU), or Municipal LGUs. 2. Final Custodianship: All financial custodianship will transition to the ABMPD Foundation Finance Subsidiary upon its accreditation with SEC, BIR, and COA. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall be effective for a period of [X] years. 2. It may be renewed upon mutual agreement of both parties. 3. Either party may terminate with 60 days‚Äô written notice. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. Both parties shall comply with all applicable laws and ABMPD policies. 2. The MOA shall not diminish the statutory powers of either party. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All information shared under this MOA shall be handled in accordance with the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and ABMPD confidentiality protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect upon signing and remain valid unless terminated under Article VI. Signed this ___ day of _, 20, in [City], Philippines. FOR KDMC HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T1.2 ‚Äì Subsidiary Oversight Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Subsidiaries: Finance, HR, Training, RME)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: ABMPD Holding Company, the governance and oversight body of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- [Subsidiary Name] (Finance / HR / Training / RME), a duly recognized functional unit established under ABMPD Holding, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as the ‚ÄúSubsidiary.‚Äù Both parties are collectively referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to formalize the oversight, accountability, and operational relationship between ABMPD Holding and its functional subsidiaries. Objectives include: 1. Standardizing governance and compliance mechanisms. 2. Defining the subsidiary‚Äôs roles in implementing ABMPD-MRP. 3. Establishing reporting lines and financial accountability. 4. Ensuring alignment with ABMPD‚Äôs Governance & MEL frameworks. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide oversight and direction to all subsidiaries. 2. Issue policy guidelines, operational standards, and compliance protocols. 3. Approve budgets, programs, and MOAs initiated by subsidiaries. 4. Monitor performance through MEL frameworks and require regular reports. The Subsidiary shall: 1. Operate within the scope of authority defined by ABMPD Holding. 2. Implement its functional mandate (Finance, HR, Training, RME). 3. Submit regular reports and documentation for transparency. 4. Ensure that activities adhere to ABMPD standards and principles. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. Oversight is vested in ABMPD Holding as the central custodian. 2. The Subsidiary is subject to compliance audits, MEL reviews, and governance protocols. 3. Disputes shall be resolved internally; unresolved issues shall be escalated to the ABMPD Governance Board. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. The Finance Subsidiary will eventually act as the sole custodian of ABMPD funds. 2. While accreditation is pending, interim custodianship may be assigned to DepEd (Provincial/Regional), SUCs (e.g., ISU), or Municipal LGUs. 3. All fund flows must be documented and logged in accordance with ABMPD finance protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall be effective for [X] years. 2. It may be renewed upon mutual agreement. 3. Either party may terminate with 60 days‚Äô written notice. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. The Subsidiary must comply with national laws, ABMPD Holding policies, and regulator requirements (SEC, BIR, COA). 2. Violations of governance protocols may result in suspension or dissolution of the Subsidiary‚Äôs authority. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All records and information handled by the Subsidiary are protected under the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and ABMPD confidentiality policies. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect upon signing and remain valid unless terminated under Article VI. Signed this ___ day of _, 20, in [City], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR [SUBSIDIARY NAME] ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T1.3 ‚Äì Regulatory Compliance Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Government Regulators: SEC, BIR, COA, DILG, DepEd)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is executed by and between: ABMPD Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- [Regulatory Agency] (SEC / BIR / COA / DILG / DepEd), a government entity duly mandated under Philippine law to regulate, accredit, or oversee compliance of institutions, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as the ‚ÄúRegulator.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to formalize ABMPD Holding‚Äôs compliance with regulatory, accreditation, and governance standards required by the Philippine government and relevant agencies. Objectives include: 1. Securing legal recognition of ABMPD Holding and its subsidiaries. 2. Establishing compliance with financial, tax, and audit standards. 3. Ensuring policy alignment with national government agencies (DepEd, DILG). 4. Providing transparency and accountability in all program operations. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Submit all required documents for registration, compliance, and accreditation. 2. Adhere to reporting requirements (annual filings, audited financials, certifications). 3. Align governance practices with national standards. 4. Facilitate DepEd-linked curriculum integration and DILG-linked LGU coordination. The Regulator shall: 1. Review and accredit ABMPD Holding in accordance with its mandate. 2. Provide technical guidance on compliance requirements. 3. Issue certificates, licenses, or clearances as appropriate. 4. Monitor ABMPD Holding‚Äôs compliance on a continuing basis. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. ABMPD Holding shall adopt internal compliance protocols subject to regulator oversight. 2. Oversight of program implementation shall be exercised in alignment with government policies. 3. Any dispute arising shall be resolved under applicable laws and through administrative remedies. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Interim custodianship of program funds may be delegated to DepEd (Provincial/Regional Offices), SUCs, or Municipal LGUs as transitional arrangements. 2. Upon accreditation, the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary shall serve as the sole and permanent custodian of funds. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall take effect upon signing and remain valid until revoked by either party. 2. Termination shall require written notice and must follow due process under government regulations. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. ABMPD Holding shall comply with all relevant laws and government issuances. 2. This MOA shall not limit the statutory powers of the Regulator. 3. Failure to comply may result in suspension, revocation, or sanctions. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All data and records submitted to the Regulator shall be handled in accordance with the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and government data-sharing protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of _, 20, in [City], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR [REGULATORY AGENCY] ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ‚ÄÉ ‚ÄÉ üìå Annex BT-T2 ‚Äì Government Templates Coverage ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Provincial Government Units (PGOs). ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî City / Municipal LGUs. ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Barangay LGUs. ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî NGA Agencies (DepEd, DILG, DOH, DSWD, TESDA, CHED). ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Inter-Agency Councils / Regional Development Councils (RDCs). ________________________________________ Summary Table of Government MOA Templates Sub-Annex Code Parties Involved Scope / Purpose Notes BT-T2.1 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî PGOs Provincial Framework MOA institutionalizing ABMPD‚ÄìMRP into provincial governance systems. Authorizes provincial integration; KCI may be designated as lead implementor by clause. BT-T2.2 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî City / Municipal LGUs City/Municipal MOA for rollout, mobilization of barangays, and logistical support. Ensures official LGU backing, staff mobilization, and resource allocation. BT-T2.3 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Barangay LGUs Barangay-level MOA anchoring grassroots participation, training, and volunteer mobilization. Entry point for MRP at community level; signed with support from municipal LGU. BT-T2.4 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî NGA Agencies (DepEd, DILG, DOH, DSWD, TESDA, CHED) Sectoral MOAs for integration in education, governance, health, social welfare, skills, and higher education. Aligns MRP with national policies and sectoral programs. BT-T2.5 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Inter-Agency Councils / RDCs Cluster or inter-agency agreements for coordination and regional replication. Enables regional scaling via RDC or inter-agency councils. ________________________________________ üìå Integration Note: ‚Ä¢ BT-T2.1‚ÄìT2.3 institutionalize ABMPD at local governance levels (province ‚Üí city/municipality ‚Üí barangay). ‚Ä¢ BT-T2.4‚ÄìT2.5 align ABMPD with national and regional governance frameworks. ‚Ä¢ All Government MOAs carry a Temporary Fund Custodianship clause (DepEd / SUCs / Municipal LGUs as interim custodians ‚Üí ABMPD Foundation Finance Subsidiary as final custodian). ________________________________________ üìå Placement Clarification: ‚Ä¢ Academic MOAs with SUCs and HEIs (ISU, AIM, etc.) ‚Üí deferred to Annex BT-T3 (Academic Templates). ‚Ä¢ Faith-Based MOAs (church networks, faith-based media) ‚Üí deferred to Annex BT-T4 (Faith-Based Templates). ‚Ä¢ Donor/Private Sector MOAs (CSR, philanthropy, endowments) ‚Üí deferred to Annex BT-T6 (Private/Donor Templates). ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T2.1 ‚Äì Provincial Government MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Provincial Government Units)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- The Provincial Government of [Province Name], a duly constituted Local Government Unit under the Republic of the Philippines, represented herein by the Honorable Governor [Name], in his/her capacity as Provincial Governor, duly authorized under Provincial Resolution/Executive Order No. [X], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúPGO.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to institutionalize the ABMPD‚ÄìMRP within the provincial governance framework to promote moral recovery, ethical leadership, and community transformation. Objectives include: 1. Integrating ABMPD‚ÄìMRP into provincial development and governance systems. 2. Authorizing rollout through municipal and barangay LGUs within the province. 3. Mobilizing provincial resources, facilities, and personnel in support of program activities. 4. Coordinating with the Kingdom Chronicles Inc. (KCI) as designated lead implementor of ABMPD‚ÄìMRP at the provincial level. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide the overall governance and framework for MRP implementation. 2. Authorize KCI as lead implementor within the province. 3. Supply technical support, training modules, and monitoring systems. 4. Ensure MEL (Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning) alignment with ABMPD standards. The Provincial Government shall: 1. Institutionalize ABMPD‚ÄìMRP through provincial ordinances, resolutions, or executive orders. 2. Allocate resources (venues, logistical support, staff assistance). 3. Coordinate with city, municipal, and barangay LGUs for program rollout. 4. Endorse the participation of DepEd divisions, SUCs, and provincial offices of NGA partners. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. Oversight shall be jointly exercised by ABMPD Holding and the Provincial Governor‚Äôs Office. 2. Program implementation shall be monitored through quarterly reports submitted to the Provincial Development Council (PDC) and integrated into ABMPD MEL systems. 3. Disputes shall first be resolved amicably between the Governor‚Äôs Office and ABMPD Holding; unresolved issues shall follow arbitration under Philippine law. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Temporary Custodianship: Program funds may be hosted by DepEd Division Offices, SUCs, or designated Provincial Treasury accounts as interim custodians. 2. Final Custodianship: Custodianship of funds shall transition to the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary upon its full accreditation with SEC, BIR, and COA. 3. All interim custodianship arrangements are strictly transitional and time-bound. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall be valid for [X] years from signing. 2. It may be renewed upon mutual agreement of the Parties. 3. Either Party may terminate this MOA with 60 days‚Äô written notice, provided that all pending obligations are settled prior to termination. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. Both Parties shall comply with all relevant laws, provincial ordinances, and ABMPD governance protocols. 2. In case of conflict, this MOA shall be interpreted in harmony with the Local Government Code and ABMPD Governance Framework. 3. This MOA shall not diminish the statutory powers of either Party. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All records and personal information shared under this MOA shall be protected under the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and relevant ABMPD confidentiality protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, at [Province], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR THE PROVINCIAL GOVERNMENT OF [PROVINCE] ________________________________________ Hon. [Name] ‚Äì Provincial Governor Witnesses: ________________________________________ Members of the Provincial Council / PDC ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T2.2 ‚Äì Municipal Government MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî City / Municipal LGUs)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- The Municipal Government of [Municipality/City Name], a duly constituted Local Government Unit under the Republic of the Philippines, represented herein by the Honorable Mayor [Name], in his/her capacity as Municipal/City Mayor, duly authorized under Municipal Resolution/Executive Order No. [X], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúLGU.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to institutionalize the ABMPD‚ÄìMRP at the municipal level as the operational base for community transformation. Objectives include: 1. Rolling out ABMPD‚ÄìMRP programs across all barangays within the municipality. 2. Mobilizing local resources, venues, and staff in support of trainings, orientations, and activities. 3. Coordinating with barangay LGUs, DepEd district offices, and community organizations for program delivery. 4. Ensuring monitoring, reporting, and feedback loops from grassroots to municipal governance structures. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide the governance framework, program modules, and monitoring systems. 2. Authorize the Kingdom Chronicles Inc. (KCI) to act as lead implementor within the municipality. 3. Deploy accredited trainers, facilitators, and Volunteer Faith/Community Advocates (VFAs/MVFAs). 4. Consolidate municipal reports and provide technical support for rollout. The Municipal LGU shall: 1. Institutionalize ABMPD‚ÄìMRP through a municipal resolution or executive order. 2. Provide logistical support (venues, staff, communications, coordination with barangays). 3. Endorse participation of barangay officials, schools, and community organizations. 4. Mobilize local funds, CSR contributions, and donor linkages for municipal implementation. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. Oversight shall be exercised jointly by ABMPD Holding and the Municipal Mayor‚Äôs Office. 2. Program implementation shall be monitored through quarterly progress reports submitted to the Municipal Development Council (MDC) and integrated into ABMPD MEL systems. 3. Disputes shall first be resolved amicably at the municipal level; unresolved issues shall follow arbitration under Philippine law. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Temporary Custodianship: Municipal Treasury, local DepEd offices, or SUCs within the municipality may serve as interim custodians of program funds. 2. Final Custodianship: All funds shall transition to the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary upon its full accreditation with SEC, BIR, and COA. 3. Interim custodianship is strictly transitional and time-bound. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall be effective for [X] years from signing. 2. Renewal shall be subject to the mutual agreement of the Parties. 3. Either Party may terminate this MOA with 60 days‚Äô written notice, provided that all pending obligations are settled prior to termination. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. Both Parties shall comply with all relevant laws, municipal ordinances, and ABMPD policies. 2. In case of conflict, this MOA shall be interpreted in harmony with the Local Government Code and ABMPD Governance Framework. 3. This MOA shall not diminish the statutory powers of either Party. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All personal and institutional data gathered in the course of this MOA shall be handled in accordance with the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and ABMPD confidentiality protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, at [Municipality/City], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR THE MUNICIPAL GOVERNMENT OF [MUNICIPALITY/CITY] ________________________________________ Hon. [Name] ‚Äì Mayor Witnesses: ________________________________________ Members of the Municipal Council / MDC üìå BT-T2.3 ‚Äì Barangay Government MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Barangay LGUs)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- The Barangay Government of [Barangay Name], [Municipality/City], [Province], a duly constituted Local Government Unit under the Republic of the Philippines, represented herein by the Honorable Barangay Captain [Name], in his/her capacity as Punong Barangay, duly authorized by Barangay Resolution No. [X], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúBarangay LGU.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to institutionalize the ABMPD‚ÄìMRP at the barangay level as the foundation of grassroots transformation and citizen engagement. Objectives include: 1. Embedding ABMPD‚ÄìMRP values and activities into barangay governance systems, in alignment with municipal and provincial rollout plans. 2. Mobilizing Volunteer Faith Advocates (VFAs) and Municipal Volunteer Faith Advocates (MVFAs) at the barangay level. 3. Supporting community-based trainings, orientations, and moral recovery activities. 4. Ensuring participation of schools, cooperatives, faith-based groups, and civil society in the barangay. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide program modules, training materials, and orientation support. 2. Authorize the Kingdom Chronicles Inc. (KCI) and accredited municipal coordinators to implement activities at the barangay level. 3. Train VFAs/MVFAs and provide monitoring and evaluation systems. 4. Consolidate barangay reports into municipal and provincial frameworks. The Barangay LGU shall: 1. Pass a barangay resolution endorsing ABMPD‚ÄìMRP. 2. Provide venues, facilities, and local manpower support for activities. 3. Endorse participation of barangay officials, schools, and community leaders. 4. Coordinate with the municipal government, DepEd schools, and community groups for broader engagement. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. Oversight shall be exercised jointly by ABMPD Holding, the Municipal Implementing Team, and the Barangay Council. 2. Barangay Monitoring Reports shall be submitted quarterly to the Municipal LGU and ABMPD coordinators, and integrated into Municipal Development Council (MDC) records. 3. Disputes shall be resolved through dialogue within the barangay council, escalating to the municipal level if unresolved. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Temporary Custodianship: The Barangay Treasury may serve as interim custodian of funds for localized implementation. 2. Final Custodianship: Custodianship of funds shall transition to the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary upon its accreditation with SEC, BIR, and COA. 3. All barangay custodianship roles are strictly time-bound and transitional. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall be effective for [X] years from signing. 2. It may be renewed upon agreement of both Parties. 3. Either Party may terminate this MOA with 60 days‚Äô written notice, provided that all pending obligations are settled prior to termination. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. Both Parties shall comply with the Local Government Code, barangay ordinances, and ABMPD policies. 2. In case of conflict, this MOA shall be interpreted in harmony with the Local Government Code and ABMPD Governance Framework. 3. This MOA shall not diminish the statutory authority of the Barangay Council or ABMPD Holding. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All records, reports, and personal information collected under this MOA shall be managed under the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and ABMPD confidentiality protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, at Barangay [Name], [Municipality/City], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR THE BARANGAY GOVERNMENT OF [BARANGAY] ________________________________________ Hon. [Name] ‚Äì Barangay Captain Witnesses: ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T2.4 ‚Äì NGA Agency MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî National Government Agencies) ________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- [National Government Agency Name] (DepEd / DILG / DOH / TESDA / CHED / DSWD / others), a duly mandated agency of the Republic of the Philippines, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as the ‚ÄúNGA.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to formalize collaboration between ABMPD Holding and [NGA] for the institutional integration of ABMPD‚ÄìMRP within the agency‚Äôs mandate. Objectives include: 1. Ensuring national policy alignment of ABMPD‚ÄìMRP with government priorities. 2. Supporting integration of moral recovery values into education, training, health, social welfare, governance, and community programs. 3. Mobilizing government resources, facilities, and technical support for grassroots rollout. 4. Establishing shared monitoring, evaluation, and reporting mechanisms. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide program frameworks, training modules, and orientation support. 2. Authorize the Kingdom Chronicles Inc. (KCI) and accredited implementors to deliver activities aligned with NGA programs. 3. Coordinate with NGA offices at national, regional, provincial, and municipal levels. 4. Submit consolidated reports for integration into NGA systems and ABMPD MEL frameworks. The NGA shall: 1.
