Endorse ABMPD‚ÄìMRP integration through national circulars, policies, or memoranda. 2. Facilitate linkages with its regional, provincial, and municipal offices. 3. Provide technical support, trainers, and sectoral expertise (e.g., DepEd for schools, TESDA for skills training, DOH for health programs). 4. Monitor compliance and program effectiveness within its jurisdiction. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. A Joint Oversight Committee shall be established, composed of representatives from ABMPD Holding and the NGA. 2. Oversight shall follow ABMPD‚Äôs Governance & MEL Framework and the NGA‚Äôs internal accountability system. 3. Disputes shall be resolved amicably through dialogue; unresolved issues shall be elevated to the NGA Secretary and ABMPD Governance Board. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Program funds may be sourced from NGA budget allocations, donor partnerships, or LGU support. 2. Temporary Custodianship: Interim custodians may include DepEd Division Offices, SUCs, or Municipal LGUs. 3. Final Custodianship: All funds shall transition to the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary upon full accreditation with SEC, BIR, and COA. 4. All fund flows shall be documented and subject to joint audit. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall be valid for [X] years from signing. 2. Renewal shall be subject to mutual agreement of the Parties. 3. Either Party may terminate with 60 days‚Äô written notice, provided pending obligations are duly settled. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. Both Parties shall comply with applicable laws, NGA regulations, and ABMPD protocols. 2. This MOA shall not diminish the statutory powers of the NGA or ABMPD Holding. 3. Anti-corruption and accountability safeguards shall apply to all transactions. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All program-related data shall be handled under the Data Privacy Act of 2012, NGA guidelines, and ABMPD confidentiality protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, at [City], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR [NATIONAL GOVERNMENT AGENCY] ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ________________________________________ Representatives of NGA & ABMPD Governance Board ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T2.5 ‚Äì Inter-Agency Council MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Inter-Agency Councils / Task Forces) ________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- [Inter-Agency Council / Regional Development Council / Task Force], a duly constituted multi-sectoral body mandated under Philippine law to coordinate governance and development initiatives, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as the ‚ÄúCouncil.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to integrate ABMPD‚ÄìMRP into the planning, coordination, and implementation frameworks of [Council], ensuring multi-agency collaboration for governance and development. Objectives include: 1. Institutionalizing ABMPD‚ÄìMRP as a recognized program within Council-led development and governance plans. 2. Aligning moral recovery initiatives with inter-agency mandates (education, health, youth, peace & order, social welfare). 3. Coordinating contributions from agencies, LGUs, and civil society for resource mobilization and technical support. 4. Monitoring and scaling ABMPD‚ÄìMRP through existing Council oversight mechanisms. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide program frameworks, training modules, and technical assistance. 2. Authorize the Kingdom Chronicles Inc. (KCI) and accredited implementors for rollout under the Council‚Äôs jurisdiction. 3. Mobilize Volunteer Faith Advocates (VFAs), UFBO, UCSO, and other partners for grassroots execution. 4. Submit consolidated reports and recommendations for Council deliberation. The Council shall: 1. Endorse ABMPD‚ÄìMRP for inclusion in official resolutions, plans, and policy frameworks. 2. Facilitate inter-agency coordination across education, health, youth, welfare, and peace-building sectors. 3. Support local governments and partner organizations in implementing ABMPD‚ÄìMRP. 4. Provide logistical, technical, and policy support for scaling and replication. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. A Joint Technical Working Group (TWG) shall be created, composed of representatives from ABMPD Holding and the Council. 2. Oversight shall follow ABMPD‚Äôs Governance & MEL Framework and the Council‚Äôs internal monitoring systems. 3. Policy decisions shall be made through Council resolutions, with concurrence of ABMPD Holding. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Resource sharing shall be based on Council resolutions and contributions from member agencies. 2. Temporary Custodianship: Funds may be hosted by designated agencies (DepEd, SUCs, or Provincial LGUs) as interim custodians. 3. Final Custodianship: Custodianship of funds shall transition to the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary once fully accredited with SEC, BIR, and COA. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall remain valid for [X] years, subject to renewal by Council resolution and agreement of ABMPD Holding. 2. Either Party may terminate with 60 days‚Äô written notice, provided all obligations are duly settled. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. Both Parties shall comply with all relevant laws, issuances, and ABMPD protocols. 2. This MOA shall not diminish the statutory mandates of the Council or ABMPD Holding. 3. Anti-corruption safeguards shall apply to all fund mobilization and resource-sharing arrangements. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All shared records and data shall be subject to the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and the Council‚Äôs internal data-sharing protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties and approval of the Council through formal resolution. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, at [City], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR [INTER-AGENCY COUNCIL / TASK FORCE] ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ________________________________________ Council & ABMPD Representatives ‚ÄÉ üìå Annex BT-T3 ‚Äì Academic Templates Coverage ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî State Universities and Colleges (SUCs). ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Higher Education Institutions (HEIs). ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Research & Leadership Institutions (e.g., AIM, ISU, regional universities). ________________________________________ Summary Table of Academic MOA Templates Sub-Annex Code Parties Involved Scope / Purpose Notes BT-T3.1 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî SUCs Partnership for training, research, curriculum integration, and interim custodianship of funds. SUCs may serve as interim custodians pending accreditation of ABMPD Finance Subsidiary. BT-T3.2 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî HEIs (Private Universities & Colleges) Integration of moral recovery values into leadership programs, extension services, and student orgs. Focus on module validation, leadership training, and civic engagement. BT-T3.3 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Research & Leadership Institutions (ISU, AIM, etc.) Specialized research, capacity building, policy development, and leadership incubation. Provides intellectual legitimacy and academic validation of ABMPD frameworks. ________________________________________ üìå Integration Note: ‚Ä¢ Academic partnerships provide research legitimacy, module validation, and training platforms. ‚Ä¢ SUCs also serve as optional interim custodians of funds, alongside DepEd and LGUs, until ABMPD Foundation Finance Subsidiary is fully accredited. ‚Ä¢ Partnerships may cross-link with Faith-Based (BT-T4) or Civil Society (BT-T5) when academic institutions also host faith/civic extension services. ________________________________________ üìå Placement Clarification: ‚Ä¢ Purely governance-related MOAs (KDMC, Holding, Regulators) ‚Üí retained under BT-T1 (Core Templates). ‚Ä¢ Government integration MOAs (LGUs, NGA agencies, RDCs) ‚Üí already structured under BT-T2 (Government Templates). ‚Ä¢ Academic donor-linked MOAs (scholarship endowments, CSR-academia linkages) ‚Üí deferred to BT-T6 (Private/Donor Templates). üìå BT-T3.1 ‚Äì SUC MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî State Universities and Colleges)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- [State University/College Name (SUC)], a duly recognized higher education institution under the Commission on Higher Education (CHED), represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúSUC.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to establish collaboration between ABMPD Holding and [SUC] for training, research, curriculum integration, and interim custodianship of program funds. Objectives include: 1. Integrating ABMPD‚ÄìMRP values, modules, and research outputs into the SUC‚Äôs academic programs, extension services, and leadership training. 2. Establishing the SUC as a hub for research, validation, and knowledge generation related to ABMPD‚ÄìMRP. 3. Supporting capacity-building of faculty, students, and local leaders through training and joint initiatives. 4. Allowing the SUC, when necessary, to serve as an interim custodian of ABMPD‚ÄìMRP funds, pending accreditation of the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide program modules, training materials, and moral recovery frameworks. 2. Authorize the Kingdom Chronicles Inc. (KCI) and other accredited implementors to conduct activities within the SUC. 3. Supply technical support, facilitators, and evaluation systems. 4. Consolidate SUC research outputs into the national ABMPD knowledge system. The SUC shall: 1. Integrate ABMPD‚ÄìMRP modules into its extension services, NSTP, leadership training, and related academic offerings. 2. Host trainings, research validation workshops, and leadership incubation sessions. 3. Mobilize faculty, student leaders, and extension units for program implementation. 4. Serve as an interim custodian of funds, if necessary, under standard government accounting and COA rules. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. Oversight shall be exercised by a Joint Academic-Program Committee composed of representatives from ABMPD Holding and [SUC]. 2. Regular reports on training, research, and fund utilization shall be submitted to ABMPD Holding and CHED Regional Office. 3. Disputes shall be resolved amicably; unresolved issues shall be elevated to arbitration under Philippine law. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Temporary Custodianship: [SUC] may hold program funds in accordance with SUC accounting standards and COA regulations. 2. Final Custodianship: All funds shall transition to the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary once fully accredited by SEC, BIR, and COA. 3. Joint accountability shall apply to all resource mobilization and expenditures. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall be valid for [X] years from signing. 2. Renewal may be executed upon mutual agreement of the Parties. 3. Either Party may terminate this MOA with 60 days‚Äô written notice, provided all obligations are settled prior to termination. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. This MOA shall comply with CHED guidelines, SUC charters, and relevant national laws. 2. It shall not diminish the statutory powers of either Party. 3. Both Parties agree to safeguard program integrity and prevent misuse of funds or authority. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All academic records, research data, and personal information collected under this MOA shall be protected under the Data Privacy Act of 2012, CHED regulations, and ABMPD confidentiality protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, at [Location], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR [STATE UNIVERSITY / COLLEGE] ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ________________________________________ ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T3.2 ‚Äì HEI MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Higher Education Institutions ‚Äì Private Universities & Colleges)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- [Higher Education Institution Name], a duly recognized private university/college accredited by the Commission on Higher Education (CHED), represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúHEI.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to collaborate on the integration of ABMPD‚ÄìMRP values, leadership training, and civic engagement within the academic, extension, and student-life programs of [HEI]. Objectives include: 1. Embedding ABMPD‚ÄìMRP moral recovery modules into leadership courses, extension programs, and student development activities. 2. Conducting joint research and validation of modules and training approaches. 3. Mobilizing student organizations and campus ministries for volunteer and civic engagement. 4. Building future leaders grounded in ethics, integrity, and service through ABMPD-aligned programs. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide moral recovery frameworks, training modules, and technical assistance. 2. Deploy accredited trainers, facilitators, and mentors to support HEI programs. 3. Authorize KCI and other partners to co-design leadership training and workshops. 4. Consolidate HEI reports into national ABMPD MEL systems. The HEI shall: 1. Integrate ABMPD‚ÄìMRP modules into leadership courses, extension projects, and student org activities. 2. Facilitate access to facilities, faculty, and student volunteers. 3. Endorse participation of student councils, ministries, and civic organizations in ABMPD programs. 4. Provide research feedback and support for continuous improvement of ABMPD modules. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. Oversight shall be exercised by a Joint Program Committee composed of ABMPD Holding and [HEI] representatives. 2. Regular reports on training, leadership integration, and research shall be submitted to ABMPD Holding and HEI‚Äôs Academic Affairs Office. 3. Disputes shall be resolved amicably; unresolved issues shall be elevated to arbitration under Philippine law. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & RESOURCE SHARING 1. Resource mobilization may include joint fundraising, CSR linkages, or donor partnerships. 2. HEI may provide counterpart support through venue use, faculty time, or logistics. 3. Custodianship of funds, if applicable, shall follow HEI accounting standards, with final transition to the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary upon accreditation. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall be valid for [X] years from signing. 2. Renewal may be done by mutual agreement. 3. Either Party may terminate with 60 days‚Äô written notice, provided obligations are settled. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. This MOA shall comply with CHED policies, HEI charters, and ABMPD standards. 2. It shall not diminish the academic freedom or statutory powers of either Party. 3. Both Parties agree to uphold ethical safeguards and accountability. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All academic, student, and program data under this MOA shall be governed by the Data Privacy Act of 2012, CHED rules, and ABMPD confidentiality protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, at [Location], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR [HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTION] ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T3.3 ‚Äì Research & Leadership Institutions MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Research & Leadership Institutions, e.g., ISU, AIM, Regional Policy & Leadership Institutes)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- [Research / Leadership Institution Name] (e.g., ISU, AIM, [Regional Leadership Institute]), a duly recognized academic or policy institution under Philippine law, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúInstitution.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to establish a strategic academic and policy partnership between ABMPD Holding and [Institution] to provide intellectual legitimacy, leadership incubation, and research-based validation of the ABMPD‚ÄìMRP framework. Objectives include: 1. Conducting joint research on values formation, governance reform, and moral recovery. 2. Developing and validating training modules, leadership programs, and policy recommendations. 3. Building a pipeline of ethical leaders through capacity-building programs and incubators. 4. Publishing academic papers, policy briefs, and research outputs that support ABMPD‚ÄìMRP. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide program frameworks, field data, and grassroots access for research. 2. Support leadership incubation through ABMPD‚Äôs network of LGUs, FBOs, and CSOs. 3. Facilitate dissemination of research findings into practice and policy. 4. Ensure integration of outputs into ABMPD‚Äôs Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning (MEL) system. [Institution] shall: 1. Conduct independent and collaborative research aligned with ABMPD‚ÄìMRP. 2. Validate ABMPD training modules and leadership curriculum. 3. Host capacity-building workshops, academic conferences, or policy forums. 4. Provide academic endorsement or certification of ABMPD programs when applicable. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. A Joint Research & Leadership Oversight Committee shall be created with equal representation from both Parties. 2. Outputs (research, policy briefs, modules) shall undergo peer review before dissemination. 3. Disputes shall be resolved amicably; unresolved matters shall follow arbitration under Philippine law. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & RESOURCE SHARING 1. Funding may come from grants, donors, CSR-academia partnerships, or institutional budgets. 2. [Institution] may provide counterpart contributions in the form of faculty time, research facilities, or scholarship slots. 3. Interim custodianship of research/project funds may be assigned to [Institution], SUCs, or DepEd until transition to the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary upon accreditation. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall remain in force for [X] years from signing. 2. Renewal shall be upon mutual agreement. 3. Either Party may terminate this MOA with 60 days‚Äô written notice, subject to settlement of pending obligations. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. This MOA shall comply with CHED rules, academic research standards, and ABMPD governance protocols. 2. It shall not diminish the academic independence of [Institution] or the statutory authority of ABMPD Holding. 3. Both Parties shall adopt safeguards against misuse of research findings or resources. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All data collected for research and leadership training shall be governed by the Data Privacy Act of 2012, academic ethical review standards, and ABMPD confidentiality protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, at [Location], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR [INSTITUTION] ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ‚ÄÉ üìå Annex BT-T4 ‚Äì Faith-Based Templates Coverage ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Unified Faith-Based Organizations (UFBO). ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Individual Faith-Based Organizations (church networks, interfaith councils, denominations). ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Faith-Based Media Partners (The 700 Club Asia, FEBC). ________________________________________ Summary Table of Faith-Based MOA Templates Sub-Annex Code Parties Involved Scope / Purpose Notes BT-T4.1 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî UFBO Accreditation MOA for unified umbrella of faith-based organizations. UFBO functions as accreditor and mobilizer of faith-based partners. BT-T4.2 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî FBOs / Interfaith Councils Partnership MOA for values integration, volunteer mobilization, and grassroots moral recovery activities. Anchors religious sector legitimacy; may overlap with barangay and CSO engagement. BT-T4.3 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Faith-Based Media (700 Club Asia, FEBC, etc.) Advocacy MOA for values-driven media campaigns, storytelling, and nationwide broadcasting. Ensures public visibility and reinforcement of ABMPD moral recovery themes. ________________________________________ üìå Integration Note: ‚Ä¢ Faith-based partnerships institutionalize ABMPD‚Äôs values framework at the grassroots and advocacy levels. ‚Ä¢ UFBO provides structured accreditation of individual FBOs, ensuring consistency with ABMPD governance. ‚Ä¢ Media partners extend ABMPD‚Äôs reach and advocacy, complementing government and civil society rollout. ________________________________________ üìå Placement Clarification: ‚Ä¢ Government-related MOAs (LGUs, NGA agencies, RDCs) ‚Üí BT-T2. ‚Ä¢ Academic-related MOAs (SUCs, HEIs, research institutions) ‚Üí BT-T3. ‚Ä¢ Donor/CSR-linked faith-based MOAs (philanthropy, CSR churches) ‚Üí BT-T6. ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T4.1 ‚Äì Unified Faith-Based Organizations (UFBO) MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî UFBO)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- Unified Faith-Based Organization (UFBO), a duly recognized umbrella body of accredited faith-based organizations, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúUFBO.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to establish UFBO as the accreditation and mobilization arm for faith-based organizations partnering with ABMPD in advancing the Moral Recovery Program (MRP). Objectives include: 1. Accrediting individual FBOs, denominations, and interfaith councils under ABMPD. 2. Mobilizing faith-based volunteers (VFAs/MVFAs) nationwide. 3. Institutionalizing values integration within churches and religious networks. 4. Providing a unified governance voice of the faith sector within ABMPD‚ÄìMRP. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide the governance framework and oversight of UFBO operations. 2. Supply training modules, orientation materials, and MEL standards. 3. Endorse UFBO as the sole accreditor of ABMPD-linked FBOs. 4. Consolidate UFBO reports into ABMPD‚Äôs MEL framework. UFBO shall: 1. Manage accreditation of FBOs and faith councils under ABMPD. 2. Mobilize faith-based networks for ABMPD rollout. 3. Provide technical assistance to member FBOs in aligning with ABMPD values. 4. Submit periodic reports on membership, mobilization, and activities. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. UFBO shall operate under ABMPD‚Äôs Governance & MEL Framework. 2. Oversight shall be jointly exercised by ABMPD Holding and UFBO‚Äôs Governing Board. 3. Disputes arising from this MOA shall be resolved amicably through dialogue; unresolved issues shall be submitted to arbitration under Philippine law. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Interim custodianship of program funds may be assigned to DepEd, SUCs, or LGUs when necessary. 2. Final custodianship of all funds shall transition to the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary upon its accreditation with SEC, BIR, and COA. 3. Resource-sharing (venues, volunteer stipends, logistics) shall be arranged jointly by Parties through separate implementing guidelines. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall be valid for [X] years from signing. 2. It may be renewed upon mutual agreement of the Parties. 3. Either Party may terminate this MOA with 60 days‚Äô written notice, provided all pending obligations are settled prior to termination. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. Both Parties shall comply with all applicable Philippine laws, ABMPD governance protocols, and relevant faith-based ethical standards. 2. This MOA shall not diminish the statutory authority of either Party. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All records, reports, and personal information shared under this MOA shall be governed by the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and ABMPD confidentiality protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, in [City], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR THE UFBO ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T4.2 ‚Äì Individual Faith-Based Organizations (FBOs) / Interfaith Councils MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî FBOs / Councils)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- [Faith-Based Organization / Interfaith Council Name], a duly recognized religious institution / faith-based council, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúFBO / Council.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to institutionalize the partnership between ABMPD Holding and [FBO / Council] to embed moral recovery and values transformation within the faith sector. Objectives include: 1. Integrating ABMPD‚ÄìMRP values into FBO programs, ministries, and activities. 2. Mobilizing church-based volunteers and VFAs for grassroots engagement. 3. Conducting community-level trainings, orientations, and advocacy campaigns. 4. Aligning FBO initiatives with UFBO accreditation and ABMPD‚Äôs governance framework. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide values-formation modules, training resources, and technical support. 2. Endorse the FBO‚Äôs accreditation through UFBO. 3. Deploy trainers and facilitators to assist in community rollout. 4. Consolidate FBO contributions into ABMPD‚Äôs monitoring and evaluation system. The FBO / Council shall: 1. Endorse and integrate ABMPD‚ÄìMRP values into sermons, ministries, and faith programs. 2. Mobilize members, leaders, and volunteers as VFAs/MVFAs. 3. Provide venues, facilities, and support services for trainings and activities. 4. Submit regular reports to UFBO and ABMPD coordinators. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. Oversight shall be exercised jointly by ABMPD Holding, UFBO, and the FBO‚Äôs Governing Body. 2. Accreditation and monitoring shall follow UFBO standards and ABMPD MEL protocols. 3. Disputes shall be resolved through dialogue, elevating unresolved issues to UFBO and ABMPD governance boards. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. FBOs may mobilize internal resources (donations, offerings, facilities) for program support. 2. Interim custodianship of external donor funds may be assigned to DepEd, SUCs, or LGUs. 3. Final custodianship shall transition to the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary once accredited. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall be effective for [X] years from signing. 2. Renewal shall be subject to the mutual consent of both Parties and UFBO accreditation. 3. Either Party may terminate with 60 days‚Äô written notice, provided all obligations are settled. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. Both Parties shall comply with national laws, ABMPD governance protocols, and UFBO accreditation standards. 2. This MOA shall not diminish the religious freedom, autonomy, or statutory authority of either Party. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All personal data and records gathered under this MOA shall be managed in accordance with the Data Privacy Act of 2012, UFBO guidelines, and ABMPD confidentiality protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, in [City], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR [FBO / COUNCIL] ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T4.3 ‚Äì Faith-Based Media MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Faith-Based Media Partners)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- [Faith-Based Media Partner Name] (e.g., The 700 Club Asia, FEBC, or other), a duly recognized faith-based media institution in the Philippines, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúMedia Partner.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to establish collaboration between ABMPD Holding and [Media Partner] for advocacy, storytelling, and nationwide media outreach in support of moral recovery and transformation. Objectives include: 1. Broadcasting ABMPD‚ÄìMRP values, stories, and community impact through mass media. 2. Producing media content (TV, radio, online) aligned with moral recovery values. 3. Amplifying grassroots and community-level initiatives to national and regional audiences. 4. Providing media-based advocacy to complement government, academic, and faith sector engagement. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide content materials, program updates, and resource persons for media features. 2. Coordinate media campaigns with UFBO, FBOs, and CSOs. 3. Ensure that shared stories and features align with ABMPD governance and MEL frameworks. 4. Provide recognition and visibility to the Media Partner as an official advocacy partner. The Media Partner shall: 1. Develop and broadcast values-driven programs, stories, and advocacy campaigns in line with ABMPD‚ÄìMRP. 2. Provide airtime, production support, and media platforms for ABMPD content. 3. Collaborate with ABMPD and UFBO in documenting grassroots impact stories. 4. Submit periodic reports on airtime contributions, audience reach, and advocacy impact. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. Oversight shall be exercised jointly by ABMPD Holding and the Media Partner‚Äôs Executive Team. 2. Media activities shall be reviewed annually for alignment with ABMPD‚Äôs advocacy framework. 3. Disputes shall be resolved amicably through mediation; unresolved issues shall be elevated to arbitration under Philippine law. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Media campaigns may be supported by donor partnerships, sponsorships, or CSR collaborations. 2. Interim custodianship of external donor funds may be assigned to SUCs, DepEd, or LGUs when applicable. 3. Final custodianship of media-related funds shall transition to the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary once accredited. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall be valid for [X] years from the date of signing. 2. Renewal may be undertaken upon mutual consent of both Parties. 3. Either Party may terminate this MOA with 60 days‚Äô written notice, subject to settlement of obligations. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. Both Parties shall comply with national media regulations, ABMPD governance protocols, and ethical standards. 2. This MOA shall not infringe upon the editorial independence or religious freedom of the Media Partner. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All program-related data, personal information, and media outputs shall be managed in accordance with the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and ABMPD confidentiality protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, in [City], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR [MEDIA PARTNER] ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ‚ÄÉ üìå Annex BT-T5 ‚Äì Civil Society Templates Coverage ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Unified Civil Society Organizations (UCSO). ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Individual CSOs, NGOs, and People‚Äôs Organizations (POs). ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Civic Federations, Cooperatives, and Community-Based Groups. ________________________________________ Summary Table of Civil Society MOA Templates Sub-Annex Code Parties Involved Scope / Purpose Notes BT-T5.1 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî UCSO Accreditation MOA establishing UCSO as umbrella for civil society partners. UCSO functions as accreditor and mobilizer for NGOs, POs, and civic groups. BT-T5.2 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Individual CSOs / NGOs / POs Partnership MOA for volunteer mobilization, civic service delivery, and community moral recovery projects. Covers sector-based NGOs (youth, women, livelihood, cooperatives). BT-T5.3 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Civic Federations & Cooperatives MOA for joint community service programs, livelihood initiatives, and cooperative-led moral recovery activities. Ensures integration of values formation into economic and civic activities. ________________________________________ üìå Integration Note: ‚Ä¢ Civil society partnerships mobilize community volunteers and civic groups as grassroots drivers of ABMPD. ‚Ä¢ UCSO provides structured accreditation, mirroring UFBO on the faith-based side. ‚Ä¢ CSOs and cooperatives become ABMPD‚Äôs implementation multipliers in barangays, municipalities, and provinces. ________________________________________ üìå Placement Clarification: ‚Ä¢ Faith-Based partners (churches, councils, media) ‚Üí BT-T4. ‚Ä¢ Academic partners (SUCs, HEIs) ‚Üí BT-T3. ‚Ä¢ Donor/CSR-linked NGOs (internationally funded CSOs, CSR-aligned civic groups) ‚Üí BT-T6. ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T5.1 ‚Äì UCSO Accreditation MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Unified Civil Society Organizations)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- Unified Civil Society Organization (UCSO), a duly recognized umbrella body for accredited civil society groups (NGOs, POs, cooperatives, federations), represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúUCSO.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to accredit UCSO as the umbrella institution for civil society engagement under the ABMPD‚ÄìMRP framework. Objectives include: 1. Institutionalizing UCSO as the accreditor and mobilizer of NGOs, POs, cooperatives, and civic groups within the ABMPD ecosystem. 2. Ensuring civil society participation in community-based moral recovery programs. 3. Coordinating volunteer mobilization, community projects, and civic advocacy efforts. 4. Establishing reporting and accountability mechanisms for civil society partners under ABMPD‚Äôs Governance & MEL Framework. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide UCSO with governance frameworks, accreditation guidelines, and oversight protocols. 2. Recognize UCSO as the sole umbrella accreditor for civil society participation under ABMPD‚ÄìMRP. 3. Supply technical training, monitoring tools, and evaluation systems. 4. Consolidate reports submitted by UCSO for integration into national ABMPD dashboards. UCSO shall: 1. Accredit NGOs, POs, and civic organizations that will partner with ABMPD at local and provincial levels. 2. Mobilize civil society volunteers for barangay, municipal, and provincial activities. 3. Ensure compliance of accredited groups with ABMPD values, standards, and governance protocols. 4. Submit quarterly reports to ABMPD Holding on partner accreditation, program rollout, and impact assessments. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. Oversight shall be jointly exercised by ABMPD Holding and the UCSO Governing Board. 2. Accreditation and compliance audits shall be conducted annually by ABMPD Holding. 3. Disputes shall be resolved amicably, or if unresolved, elevated to arbitration under Philippine law. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Civil society activities may be supported through LGU allocations, donor funds, or CSR contributions. 2. Interim custodianship of funds may be held by LGUs, DepEd, or SUCs for specific projects. 3. Final custodianship of funds shall transition to the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary once accredited. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall remain in force for [X] years from signing. 2. It may be renewed upon mutual agreement of the Parties. 3. Either Party may terminate with 60 days‚Äô written notice, provided that pending obligations are duly settled. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. Both Parties shall comply with Philippine laws, ABMPD protocols, and civil society regulations. 2. This MOA shall not diminish the statutory powers of either Party. 3. Non-compliance by UCSO or its members may result in suspension or revocation of accreditation. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All information, records, and personal data collected under this MOA shall be handled in accordance with the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and ABMPD confidentiality policies. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, at [City], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR UNIFIED CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATION (UCSO) ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T5.2 ‚Äì Individual CSO / NGO / PO Partnership MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Individual CSOs / NGOs / POs)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- [Civil Society Organization / NGO / People‚Äôs Organization Name], a duly registered organization under Philippine law, engaged in [sectoral focus: youth, women, livelihood, cooperatives, civic development, etc.], represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúCSO/NGO/PO.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to establish a formal partnership between ABMPD Holding and [CSO/NGO/PO] to jointly implement community-based moral recovery, values formation, and civic development programs. Objectives include: 1. Engaging civil society partners in volunteer mobilization and moral recovery initiatives. 2. Supporting grassroots service delivery in alignment with ABMPD‚ÄìMRP frameworks. 3. Ensuring integration of ABMPD values into the CSO‚Äôs existing projects (livelihood, youth, women, education, etc.). 4. Establishing accountability mechanisms for reporting, compliance, and impact assessment. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide governance framework, program modules, and technical support. 2. Authorize UCSO to accredit [CSO/NGO/PO] as a recognized ABMPD partner. 3. Deliver training, orientation, and monitoring tools. 4. Consolidate performance reports for integration into ABMPD MEL systems. The CSO/NGO/PO shall: 1. Mobilize volunteers and community members for ABMPD-related projects. 2. Implement activities (trainings, forums, outreach, civic service) aligned with ABMPD values. 3. Submit quarterly reports to UCSO and ABMPD Holding. 4. Ensure compliance with ABMPD governance standards and Philippine laws. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. Oversight shall be jointly exercised by ABMPD Holding and UCSO, with active participation of the CSO/NGO/PO. 2. Accredited CSOs shall be subject to annual compliance reviews and performance evaluations. 3. Disputes shall be resolved amicably; unresolved matters shall be referred to arbitration under Philippine law. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Project-specific funding may be sourced from LGUs, donors, or CSR linkages. 2. Interim custodianship of funds may be designated to LGUs, DepEd, or SUCs for accountability. 3. Final custodianship will be exercised by the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary once accredited. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall remain in force for [X] years from signing. 2. It may be renewed upon agreement of the Parties. 3. Either Party may terminate with 60 days‚Äô written notice, subject to settlement of obligations. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. Both Parties shall comply with Philippine laws, ABMPD protocols, and UCSO accreditation guidelines. 2. Failure to comply may result in suspension or revocation of accreditation. 3. This MOA shall not diminish the statutory authority of either Party. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All data, records, and personal information collected under this MOA shall be handled in accordance with the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and ABMPD confidentiality standards. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, in [City], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR [CSO / NGO / PO NAME] ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T5.3 ‚Äì Civic Federations & Cooperatives MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Civic Federations & Cooperatives)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- [Federation / Cooperative Name], a duly registered cooperative, civic federation, or umbrella body recognized under Philippine law, engaged in [sector focus: livelihood, agriculture, transport, labor, women‚Äôs cooperatives, etc.], represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúFederation/Cooperative.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to establish a partnership between ABMPD Holding and [Federation/Cooperative] to integrate moral recovery and values formation into civic and cooperative-based programs. Objectives include: 1. Embedding ABMPD‚ÄìMRP values into cooperative governance, livelihood initiatives, and civic programs. 2. Mobilizing cooperative members and civic groups as community volunteers for ABMPD. 3. Supporting livelihood and service delivery projects aligned with moral recovery objectives. 4. Ensuring accountability through structured monitoring, reporting, and compliance mechanisms. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide governance frameworks, training modules, and technical support. 2. Authorize UCSO to accredit [Federation/Cooperative] as a recognized ABMPD partner. 3. Facilitate capacity-building workshops for cooperative leaders and members. 4. Consolidate program performance into ABMPD‚Äôs MEL systems. The Federation/Cooperative shall: 1. Endorse ABMPD‚ÄìMRP integration into cooperative/community programs. 2. Mobilize members and leaders as volunteers and advocates for ABMPD initiatives. 3. Allocate resources (venues, facilities, logistics) for joint activities. 4. Submit periodic reports to UCSO and ABMPD Holding on implementation progress. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. Oversight shall be jointly exercised by ABMPD Holding, UCSO, and the Federation/Cooperative. 2. Cooperative compliance shall be reviewed annually against ABMPD standards and cooperative principles. 3. Disputes shall be resolved through dialogue; unresolved issues shall proceed to arbitration under Philippine law. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Cooperative funds may be pooled with ABMPD projects through joint financing or donor linkages. 2. Interim custodianship of external funds may be delegated to LGUs, SUCs, or DepEd when applicable. 3. Final custodianship of all ABMPD-related funds will transition to the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary upon accreditation. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall remain in force for [X] years from signing. 2. Renewal shall be subject to the agreement of the Parties. 3. Either Party may terminate with 60 days‚Äô written notice, provided that all pending obligations are fulfilled. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. Both Parties shall comply with the Cooperative Code of the Philippines, ABMPD policies, and applicable Philippine laws. 2. This MOA shall not diminish the statutory mandates of either Party. 3. Failure to comply may result in suspension or termination of accreditation. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All records, reports, and member information under this MOA shall be governed by the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and ABMPD confidentiality standards. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, at [City/Province], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR [FEDERATION / COOPERATIVE NAME] ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ________________________________________ ‚ÄÉ üìå Annex BT-T6 ‚Äì Private Sector & Donor Templates ________________________________________ Coverage ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) Programs. ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Private Foundations (family, corporate, philanthropic). ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Business Federations (Chambers of Commerce, Cooperatives). ‚Ä¢ ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Individual/Philanthropic Donors (local & diaspora). ________________________________________ Summary Table of Private/Donor MOA Templates Sub-Annex Code Parties Involved Scope / Purpose Notes BT-T6.1 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî CSR Programs (Corporations, SMEs) CSR MOAs ‚Äì funding support, employee volunteerism, program sponsorships. Ensures alignment of CSR initiatives with ABMPD‚Äôs values & MEL framework. BT-T6.2 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Private Foundations (Family / Philanthropic / Corporate) Foundation MOAs ‚Äì endowment funds, scholarships, and sustainability support. May include naming rights, recognition clauses, or joint branding. BT-T6.3 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Business Federations (Chambers, Cooperatives) Business sector partnership MOAs ‚Äì resource pooling, cooperative integration, entrepreneurship training. Useful for mobilizing cooperatives and livelihood support at community level. BT-T6.4 ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Individual Donors / Diaspora Donor MOAs ‚Äì structured contributions (financial, in-kind, technical expertise). Standardized donor agreements ensure traceability and accountability. ________________________________________ üìå Integration Note: ‚Ä¢ BT-T6.1‚ÄìT6.2 ‚Üí secure financial sustainability through CSR and foundations. ‚Ä¢ BT-T6.3 ‚Üí engages business networks for community enterprise support. ‚Ä¢ BT-T6.4 ‚Üí institutionalizes donor trust via formalized agreements, reducing risk of informal/untracked contributions. ‚Ä¢ All donor/CSR MOAs must include custodianship clauses (interim DepEd/SUCs/LGUs ‚Üí final ABMPD Foundation Finance Subsidiary). ________________________________________ üìå Placement Clarification: ‚Ä¢ International/INGO donor MOAs ‚Üí Annex BT-T7 (International Templates). ‚Ä¢ Faith-based donor foundations (church-linked, mission funds) ‚Üí Annex BT-T4 (Faith-Based Templates). ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T6.1 ‚Äì CSR Programs MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî CSR Programs ‚Äì Corporations / SMEs)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- [Company Name], a duly registered corporation under Philippine law, with established Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) programs, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúCompany.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to establish a Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) partnership between ABMPD Holding and [Company] for the promotion of moral recovery, ethical leadership, and community transformation through shared resources and aligned CSR initiatives. Objectives include: 1. Supporting ABMPD‚ÄìMRP programs through financial sponsorships, grants, and donations. 2. Mobilizing employee-volunteer programs to participate in community-based ABMPD activities. 3. Sponsoring specific events, training sessions, or livelihood initiatives aligned with ABMPD‚Äôs values framework. 4. Ensuring that CSR contributions are aligned with ABMPD‚Äôs MEL (Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning) standards for accountability. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide program frameworks, technical guidance, and monitoring tools. 2. Ensure that sponsored projects comply with ABMPD standards and MEL protocols. 3. Acknowledge the Company‚Äôs CSR contributions through official communications, reports, and events. 4. Facilitate employee-volunteer training and integration into ABMPD community activities. The Company shall: 1. Allocate CSR funds and/or resources to ABMPD‚ÄìMRP programs. 2. Mobilize employees for volunteer participation in ABMPD activities. 3. Provide logistical support for CSR-linked projects (e.g., venues, equipment, transportation). 4. Submit financial and narrative reports on CSR contributions for transparency. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. Oversight shall be jointly exercised by ABMPD Holding and the Company‚Äôs CSR Department. 2. Regular joint reviews (at least annually) shall be conducted to evaluate impact, compliance, and future directions. 3. Disputes shall be resolved amicably; unresolved issues shall be subject to arbitration under Philippine law. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. CSR funds may be temporarily hosted by DepEd, SUCs, or designated LGUs as interim custodians where applicable. 2. Final custodianship of CSR contributions shall transition to the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary upon its full accreditation (SEC, BIR, COA, BSP if applicable). 3. All funds must be tracked and reported through ABMPD‚Äôs MEL and financial accountability systems. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall remain in force for [X] years from signing. 2. Renewal may be made upon mutual agreement of the Parties. 3. Either Party may terminate the MOA with 60 days‚Äô written notice, provided that pending obligations are fulfilled. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. Both Parties shall comply with Philippine laws, ABMPD governance standards, and corporate CSR regulations. 2. This MOA shall not diminish the statutory mandates of either Party. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All donor records, financial data, and personal information of volunteers under this MOA shall be governed by the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and ABMPD confidentiality policies. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, at [City], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR [COMPANY NAME] ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T6.2 ‚Äì Private Foundations MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Private Foundations ‚Äì Family / Philanthropic / Corporate)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- [Foundation Name], a duly registered private foundation under Philippine law, dedicated to philanthropic, charitable, and/or development programs, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúFoundation.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to establish a formal partnership between ABMPD Holding and [Foundation] for the advancement of the ABMPD‚ÄìMRP through financial support, scholarships, endowment funds, and joint programs. Objectives include: 1. Securing philanthropic and foundation-based support for ABMPD‚ÄìMRP programs. 2. Establishing endowment funds or trust arrangements for program sustainability. 3. Supporting scholarships, capacity building, and training initiatives under ABMPD. 4. Enabling joint advocacy, recognition programs, and co-branded initiatives. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide governance frameworks and oversight for foundation-funded initiatives. 2. Ensure funds are used solely for agreed purposes under ABMPD programs. 3. Conduct regular reporting on the impact, financial utilization, and program outcomes. 4. Grant recognition and acknowledgment of the Foundation‚Äôs contribution in ABMPD events, reports, and publications. The Foundation shall: 1. Provide financial grants, endowments, or in-kind contributions to ABMPD programs. 2. Collaborate in scholarship or community projects aligned with ABMPD objectives. 3. Monitor funded projects and receive periodic reports from ABMPD Holding. 4. Engage in joint advocacy, recognition, or branding activities where applicable. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. Oversight shall be conducted jointly by ABMPD Holding and the Foundation‚Äôs Board/Executive Committee. 2. Annual joint reviews shall evaluate the impact, compliance, and effectiveness of the partnership. 3. Disputes shall be resolved amicably; unresolved matters shall be elevated to arbitration under Philippine law. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Interim custodianship of funds may be entrusted to DepEd, SUCs, or designated LGUs when required by donor mechanisms. 2. Final custodianship of all foundation-provided funds shall rest with the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary once fully accredited (SEC, BIR, COA, BSP if applicable). 3. All contributions shall be tracked through ABMPD‚Äôs MEL and financial accountability systems to ensure transparency and donor trust. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall be valid for [X] years from signing unless otherwise terminated. 2. Renewal may be made upon mutual agreement. 3. Either Party may terminate this MOA with 60 days‚Äô prior written notice, provided all pending obligations are settled. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. Both Parties shall comply with Philippine laws, ABMPD governance standards, and applicable foundation regulations. 2. This MOA shall not impair the statutory or corporate mandates of either Party. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All donor records, scholarship data, and personal information shall be governed by the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and ABMPD confidentiality protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, at [City], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR [FOUNDATION NAME] ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: ‚ÄÉ üìå BT-T6.3 ‚Äì Business Federations MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Business Federations ‚Äì Chambers of Commerce, Cooperatives, Trade/Industry Associations)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- [Business Federation Name], a duly registered chamber of commerce, cooperative federation, or industry/business association under Philippine law, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúBusiness Federation.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to formalize a partnership between ABMPD Holding and [Business Federation] to align business sector initiatives with the ABMPD‚ÄìMRP values framework, integrating livelihood, entrepreneurship, and community service into moral recovery efforts. Objectives include: 1. Mobilizing business sector support for ABMPD programs through corporate and cooperative initiatives. 2. Integrating values-based leadership into entrepreneurship and cooperative training. 3. Supporting livelihood programs, job generation, and community-based enterprises. 4. Providing platforms for employee/entrepreneur volunteerism and civic engagement. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide the governance and values framework to guide business engagement under ABMPD‚ÄìMRP. 2. Supply training modules on ethical leadership, moral recovery, and social responsibility. 3. Coordinate with KCI (Kingdom Chronicles Inc.) and relevant subsidiaries to support program implementation. 4. Monitor and evaluate outcomes using ABMPD‚Äôs MEL (Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning) system. The Business Federation shall: 1. Endorse ABMPD‚ÄìMRP to its member organizations and cooperatives. 2. Mobilize business resources (financial, in-kind, technical expertise) in support of ABMPD programs. 3. Provide venues, training facilities, and business mentors for entrepreneurship and livelihood projects. 4. Integrate ABMPD values into cooperative education programs, leadership summits, and CSR initiatives. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. Oversight shall be exercised jointly by ABMPD Holding and the Federation‚Äôs Governing Board. 2. A Joint Business-ABMPD Committee may be created to monitor initiatives, evaluate impact, and recommend improvements. 3. Disputes shall be resolved amicably through consultation; unresolved matters shall proceed to arbitration under Philippine law. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Business contributions (cash or in-kind) may be channeled through interim custodians such as SUCs, DepEd, or LGUs when appropriate. 2. Final custodianship of all business sector funds shall transition to the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary once accredited (SEC, BIR, COA, BSP if applicable). 3. All resource use shall be properly documented and reported to ensure transparency, accountability, and alignment with ABMPD‚Äôs MEL system. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall remain valid for [X] years unless otherwise terminated. 2. Renewal may be made upon mutual agreement. 3. Either Party may terminate this MOA with 60 days‚Äô prior written notice, provided that all pending obligations are settled. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. Both Parties shall comply with Philippine laws, cooperative regulations, and ABMPD governance standards. 2. This MOA shall not impair the statutory authority of either Party or its member institutions. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION All membership records, financial contributions, and participant data shall be governed by the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and ABMPD confidentiality protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, at [City], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR [BUSINESS FEDERATION] ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] Witnesses: üìå BT-T6.4 ‚Äì Individual Donors / Diaspora MOA Template (ABMPD Holding ‚Üî Individual Donors / Diaspora Supporters)________________________________________ ARTICLE I ‚Äì PARTIES & AUTHORITY This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is entered into by and between: Ang Bayaning May Puso at Dang√°l (ABMPD) Holding Company, the institutional custodian of the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program (MRP), with full oversight of its subsidiaries, represented herein by [Name], in his/her capacity as [Position], hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúABMPD Holding‚Äù; -and- [Donor Name], a private individual and supporter of ABMPD‚ÄìMRP, residing in [Location], hereinafter referred to as the ‚ÄúDonor.‚Äù Collectively, the above shall be referred to as the ‚ÄúParties.‚Äù ________________________________________ ARTICLE II ‚Äì PURPOSE & OBJECTIVES The purpose of this MOA is to formalize the contribution of individual and diaspora donors to ABMPD‚ÄìMRP, ensuring accountability, transparency, and alignment with the program‚Äôs governance and moral recovery objectives. Objectives include: 1. Institutionalizing structured contributions (financial, in-kind, technical expertise) from donors. 2. Providing assurance that donor support is used exclusively for ABMPD‚ÄìMRP programs and activities. 3. Embedding donor contributions into ABMPD‚Äôs MEL (Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning) framework for accountability. 4. Offering recognition, reporting, and transparency mechanisms to donors. ________________________________________ ARTICLE III ‚Äì ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ABMPD Holding shall: 1. Provide official acknowledgment and documentation of donor contributions. 2. Ensure contributions are applied only to agreed programmatic activities. 3. Submit periodic reports to donors on fund utilization and program impact. 4. Maintain records and transparency through ABMPD‚Äôs MEL and Finance systems. The Donor shall: 1. Provide contributions as specified (financial, in-kind, or services/expertise). 2. Respect ABMPD governance structures in determining the application of contributions. 3. Maintain confidentiality regarding sensitive internal program matters, unless authorized for public release. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IV ‚Äì GOVERNANCE & OVERSIGHT 1. Oversight shall be exercised by ABMPD Holding and its Finance Subsidiary. 2. Donors may be provided periodic updates and reports but will not exercise operational control. 3. Any disputes shall be resolved amicably, or if unresolved, through arbitration under Philippine law. ________________________________________ ARTICLE V ‚Äì FUNDING & CUSTODIANSHIP 1. Contributions may be temporarily received and hosted by interim custodians such as SUCs, DepEd, or LGUs, when necessary. 2. Final custodianship of all contributions shall rest with the ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary once accredited (SEC, BIR, COA, BSP). 3. All contributions shall be receipted, recorded, and reported to ensure full accountability. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VI ‚Äì TERM & TERMINATION 1. This MOA shall remain valid for [X] years from signing unless earlier terminated. 2. Donors may request to discontinue support with 30 days‚Äô written notice. 3. ABMPD may terminate the MOA if donor contributions are inconsistent with ABMPD governance or ethical standards. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VII ‚Äì COMPLIANCE & LEGAL SAFEGUARDS 1. This MOA shall comply with Philippine laws on donations, anti-money laundering, and taxation. 2. Contributions shall not be used for political or partisan purposes. 3. Donor anonymity may be protected upon request, subject to legal compliance. ________________________________________ ARTICLE VIII ‚Äì CONFIDENTIALITY & DATA PROTECTION Donor information, contribution records, and personal data shall be managed under the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and ABMPD confidentiality protocols. ________________________________________ ARTICLE IX ‚Äì EFFECTIVITY & EXECUTION This MOA shall take effect immediately upon signing by the authorized representatives of the Parties. Signed this ___ day of [Month], 20__, in [City], Philippines. FOR ABMPD HOLDING ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì [Position] FOR THE DONOR ________________________________________ [Name] ‚Äì Donor Witnesses: ‚ÄÉ üìå Annex BT-T7 ‚Äì International Templates ________________________________________ Framing Note At the international level, KDMC Holding serves as the primary strategic anchor for donor negotiations and global partnerships. It acts as the face of the program to INGOs, UN agencies, bilateral donors, and multilateral institutions. Meanwhile, ABMPD Holding, as the domestic custodian, co-signs all MOAs to ensure governance alignment, legal compliance, and accountability within the Philippines. This dual-anchor system ensures that the program can secure international legitimacy and resources while maintaining domestic control, integrity, and sustainability. ________________________________________ Coverage The following templates standardize engagement with international partners: Template Counterpart Type Primary Purpose BT-T7.1 International Non-Governmental Organizations (INGOs) Scaling, community-based technical cooperation BT-T7.2 UN Agencies Policy alignment, technical support, global validation BT-T7.3 Multilateral Development Banks (ADB, WB, etc.) Large-scale financing, safeguards compliance BT-T7.4 Bilateral Donors (USAID, JICA, KOICA, etc.) Program funding, capacity-building, pilot rollouts BT-T7.5 International Academic / Technical Partners Research validation, knowledge exchange, leadership development ________________________________________ Standard Governance & Safeguards (Applied to All Templates) To ensure coherence and integrity, each international MOA includes: 1. Parties & Authority ‚Äì Recognition of legal identity, mandates, and authority. 2. Purpose & Objectives ‚Äì Alignment with ABMPD Masterplan and donor priorities. 3. Roles & Responsibilities ‚Äì Division of tasks between KDMC, ABMPD, and partner. 4. Governance & Oversight ‚Äì Creation of a Joint Steering Committee (JSC) for all agreements (with sectoral modifiers where needed, e.g., JSC-Education, JSC-Finance). 5. Funding & Custodianship Clause ‚Äì Funds held interim by DepEd/SUCs/LGUs; final custodianship by ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary. 6. Term & Termination ‚Äì Duration, renewal, and termination mechanisms. 7. Compliance & Legal Safeguards ‚Äì Philippine law + donor regulations; arbitration mechanisms. 8. Confidentiality & Data Protection ‚Äì Alignment with Data Privacy Act and international standards (e.g., GDPR where relevant). 9. Effectivity & Execution ‚Äì Notarial acknowledgment in the Philippines; dual signature block (KDMC + ABMPD + partner). ________________________________________ Template MOAs BT-T7.1 ‚Äì MOA with INGOs ‚Ä¢ Parties & Authority KDMC Holding (international anchor) and ABMPD Holding (domestic custodian) ‚Üî [INGO]. ‚Ä¢ Purpose & Objectives To support community-based initiatives, pilot programs, and technical cooperation under the ABMPD Moral Recovery Program. ‚Ä¢ Roles & Responsibilities o KDMC Holding: Donor liaison, resource mobilization. o ABMPD Holding: Program custodian, ensures compliance and rollout. o INGO: Provides technical assistance, grants, field expertise. ‚Ä¢ Governance & Oversight Managed by a Joint Steering Committee (JSC-INGO). ‚Ä¢ Funding & Custodianship Interim custodianship (DepEd/SUCs/LGUs) ‚Üí Final custodianship (ABMPD Foundation ‚Äì Finance Subsidiary). ________________________________________ BT-T7.2 ‚Äì MOA with UN Agencies ‚Ä¢ Parties & Authority KDMC Holding & ABMPD Holding ‚Üî [UN Agency]. ‚Ä¢ Purpose & Objectives To align ABMPD MRP with UN frameworks (e.g., SDGs, UNDP development agenda) and provide technical validation and policy guidance. ‚Ä¢ Roles & Responsibilities o KDMC Holding: Global coordination, reporting. o ABMPD Holding: National rollout and compliance. o UN Agency: Technical support, advocacy, policy advice. ‚Ä¢ Governance & Oversight Joint Steering Committee (JSC-UN) with policy advisory sub-groups. ‚Ä¢ Funding & Custodianship Same as BT-T7.1. ________________________________________ BT-T7.3 ‚Äì MOA with Multilateral Development Banks ‚Ä¢ Parties & Authority KDMC Holding & ABMPD Holding ‚Üî [ADB/WB/Other MDB]. ‚Ä¢ Purpose & Objectives To access large-scale financing, infrastructure, and institutional strengthening for ABMPD rollouts. ‚Ä¢ Roles & Responsibilities o KDMC Holding: Negotiates loan/grant agreements. o ABMPD Holding: Implements and manages compliance safeguards. o MDB Partner: Provides funding, capacity-building, fiduciary oversight. ‚Ä¢ Governance & Oversight Joint Steering Committee (JSC-Finance); mandatory independent audit & safeguard compliance. ‚Ä¢ Funding & Custodianship Same as BT-T7.1, with enhanced fiduciary safeguards and independent auditing. ________________________________________ BT-T7.4 ‚Äì MOA with Bilateral Donors ‚Ä¢ Parties & Authority KDMC Holding & ABMPD Holding ‚Üî [USAID/JICA/KOICA/etc.]. ‚Ä¢ Purpose & Objectives To secure bilateral donor funding for pilot projects, technical training, and local capacity-building. ‚Ä¢ Roles & Responsibilities o KDMC Holding: International negotiation and reporting. o ABMPD Holding: Custodian and implementer in the Philippines. o Donor Agency: Funding, technical missions, evaluation. ‚Ä¢ Governance & Oversight Joint Steering Committee (JSC-Bilateral) with donor participation. ‚Ä¢ Funding & Custodianship Same as BT-T7.1, with annual third-party audit. ________________________________________ BT-T7.5 ‚Äì MOA with International Academic / Technical Partners ‚Ä¢ Parties & Authority KDMC Holding & ABMPD Holding ‚Üî [Foreign University / Technical Institute]. ‚Ä¢ Purpose & Objectives To foster academic research collaboration, joint leadership training, curriculum validation, and exchange programs. ‚Ä¢ Roles & Responsibilities o KDMC Holding: Facilitates international linkages. o ABMPD Holding: Integrates outputs into national program rollout. o Partner Institution: Provides research expertise, training resources, visiting faculty. ‚Ä¢ Governance & Oversight Joint Steering Committee (JSC-Academia). ‚Ä¢ Funding & Custodianship Same as BT-T7.1. ________________________________________ Integration Notes ‚Ä¢ BT-T7 links back to the Master Repository in Part XII, Section 12.2. ‚Ä¢
